translation.text: Then, after him, We sent messengers unto their folk, and they brought them clear proofs. But they were not ready to believe in that which they before denied. Thus print We on the hearts of the transgressors.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: After him We sent Messengers to their nation. They brought them clear signs, but they were not of those to believe because they had belied it previously. SoWe seal the hearts of the evildoers.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then We sent after him messengers to their peoples, and they came to them with clear proofs. But they were not to believe in that which they had denied before. Thus We seal over the hearts of the transgressors

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: After (Noah) We sent other Messengers to their people with clear authoritative evidence proving their prophetic claims). But how could the people believe what they had previously called lies? Thus do We seal the hearts of the transgressors.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: After him We sent other messengers to their respective peoples, and they brought them clear proofs. But they would not believe in the truth, because they had rejected it before. Thus We seal up the hearts of the transgressors.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then after him We sent (many) messengers to their peoples: they brought them Clear Signs, but they would not believe what they had already rejected beforehand. Thus do We seal the hearts of the transgressors.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Our messengers came to Abraham with the good tidings; they said, 'Peace!' 'Peace,' he said; and presently he brought a roasted calf.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And assuredly Our messengers came unto Ibrahim with the glad tidings. The said: peace! He said: peace! And he tarried not till he brougt a calf roasted.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And verily, there came Our Messengers to Ibrahim (Abraham) with glad tidings. They said: Salam (greetings or peace!) He answered, Salam (greetings or peace!) and he hastened to entertain them with a roasted calf.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Our messengers came to Abraham with good news. They said, “Peace.” He said, “Peace.” Soon after, he came with a roasted calf.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Indeed Our messengers came to Abraham, bearing glad tidings. They greeted him with 'peace', and Abraham answered back to them 'peace', and hurriedly brought to them a roasted calf.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And verily, there came Our messengers to Ibrahim with the glad tidings. They said: "Salaman (greetings or peace!)" He answered, "Salamun (greetings or peace!)," and he hastened to entertain them with a roasted calf.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And Our messengers cam unto Abraham with good news. They said: Peace! He answered: Peace! and delayed not to bring a roasted calf.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly Our messengers came to Abraham with the good news, and said, ‘Peace!’ ‘Peace!’ He replied. Presently he brought [for them] a roasted calf.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Our Messengers came to Abraham with glad tidings. They said: 'Peace' He replied 'Peace' and in a while brought them a roasted calf.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And certainly did Our messengers come to Abraham with good tidings; they said, "Peace." He said, "Peace," and did not delay in bringing [them] a roasted calf.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Our Messengers came to Abraham with glad news. They said, "Peace be with you." He replied similarly. After a short time he presented them with a roasted calf

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Our messengers came to Abraham with good news and greeted him with, "Peace." He too said, "Peace be on you," and hastened to bring a roasted calf.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: There came Our messengers to Abraham with glad tidings. They said, "Peace!" He answered, "Peace!" and hastened to entertain them with a roasted calf.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: The king said: "Bring him to me. So when the messenger came to Joseph, he said: "Go back to your lord and ask him: 'How fare the women who had cut their hands?' My Lord is cognisant of their guile."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: The king said, 'Bring him to me!' And when the messenger came to him, he said, 'Return unto thy lord, and ask of him, "What of the women who cut their hands?" Surely my Lord has knowledge of their guile.'

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And the king said: bring him Unto me. Then, when the messenger came to him, he said: return to thy lord, and ask him, what about the women who cut their hands! verily my Lord is the Knower of their guile.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And the king said: "Bring him to me." But when the messenger came to him, [Yusuf (Joseph)] said: "Return to your lord and ask him, 'What happened to the women who cut their hands? Surely, my Lord (Allah) is Well-Aware of their plot. 

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: The king said: "Bring this man to me." But when the royal messenger came to Joseph he said: "Go back to your master and ask him about the case of the women who had cut their hands. Surely my Lord has full knowledge of their guile."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And the king said: "Bring him to me." But when the messenger came to him, [Yusuf] said: "Return to your king and ask him, `What happened to the women who cut their hands Surely, my Lord (Allah) is Well-Aware of their plot."'

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And the king said: Bring him unto me. And when the messenger came unto him, he (Joseph) said: Return unto thy lord and ask him what was the case of the women who cut their hands. Lo! my Lord knoweth their guile.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: The king said, ‘Bring him to me!’ When the messenger came to him, he said, ‘Go back to your master, and ask him about the affair of women who cut their hands. My Lord is indeed well aware of their stratagems.’

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And the king said, "Bring him to me." But when the messenger came to him, [Joseph] said, "Return to your master and ask him what is the case of the women who cut their hands. Indeed, my Lord is Knowing of their plan."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The King ordered his people to bring Joseph into his presence. When the messenger came to Joseph, he (Joseph) said, "Ask your master about the women who cut their hands. My Lord knows all about their guile".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And the king said: Bring him to me. So when the messenger came to him, he said: Go back to your lord and ask him, what is the case of the women who cut their hands; surely my Lord knows their guile.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: The king said, "Bring him to me." When the king's messenger came to Joseph, he said, "Go back to your master and ask him about the women who cut their hands: my Lord knows well their guile."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So the king said: "Bring ye him unto me." But when the messenger came to him, (Joseph) said: "Go thou back to thy lord, and ask him, 'What is the state of mind of the ladies who cut their hands'? For my Lord is certainly well aware of their snare."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We never sent a messenger who did not speak the tongue of his people, that he may explain to them distinctly. God leads whosoever He wills astray, and shows whoever He wills the way: He is all-mighty and all-wise.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And We sent every Noble Messenger with the same language as his people*, so that he may clearly explain to them; then Allah sends astray whomever He wills, and He guides whomever He wills; and He only is the Most Honourable, the Wise. (* Prophet Mohammed (peace and blessings be upon him) was taught all the languages as he is sent towards all.)

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We have sent no Messenger save with the tongue of his people, that he might make all clear to them; then God leads astray whomsoever He will, and He guides whomsoever He will; and He is the All-mighty, the All-wise.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We sent not a Messenger except with the language of his people, in order that he might make (the Message) clear for them. Then Allah misleads whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We never sent any messenger except in the language of his people, to make things clear for them. God leads astray whom He wills, and guides whom He wills. He is the Mighty, the Wise.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Never have We sent a Messenger but he has addressed his people in their language that he may fully expound his Message to them. (And after the Message is expounded), Allah lets go astray whomsoever He wills, and guides to the Right Way whomsoever He wills. He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And We sent not a Messenger except with the language of his people, in order that he might make (the Message) clear for them. Then Allah misleads whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We never sent a messenger save with the language of his folk, that he might make (the message) clear for them. Then Allah sendeth whom He will astray, and guideth whom He will. He is the Mighty, the Wise.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We have sent no Messenger except in the tongue of his own nation, so that he might make everything plain to them. But Allah leads astray whom He will and guides whom He will. He is the Almighty, the Wise.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We did not send any messenger except [speaking] in the language of his people to state clearly for them, and Allah sends astray [thereby] whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: All the Messengers that We sent spoke the language of their people so that they could explain (their message to them). God guides or causes to go astray whomever He wants. He is Majestic and All-wise.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Each messenger We have sent has spoken in the language of his own people, so that he might make the message clear to them. But God lets go astray whom He will and guides whom He pleases. He is the Almighty, the All Wise.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We sent not a messenger except (to teach) in the language of his (own) people, in order to make (things) clear to them. Now Allah leaves straying those whom He pleases and guides whom He pleases: and He is Exalted in power, full of Wisdom.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "He who finds the right path does so for himself; and he who goes astray does so to his own loss; and no one who carries a burden bears another's load. We never punish till We have sent a messenger.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Whoever came to guidance, has come for his own good; and whoever went astray, has strayed for his own ruin; and no burdened soul will bear another’s burden; and We never punish until We have sent a Noble Messenger.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Whosoever is guided, is only guided to his own gain, and whosoever goes astray, it is only to his own loss; no soul laden bears the load of another. We never chastise, until We send forth a Messenger.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Whoever goes right, then he goes right only for the benefit of his ownself. And whoever goes astray, then he goes astray to his own loss. No one laden with burdens can bear another's burden. And We never punish until We have sent a Messenger (to give warning).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Whoever is guided—is guided for his own good. And whoever goes astray—goes astray to his detriment. No burdened soul carries the burdens of another, nor do We ever punish until We have sent a messenger.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: He who follows the Right Way shall do so to his own advantage; and he who strays shall incur his own loss. No one shall bear another's burden. And never do We punish any people until We send a Messenger (to make the Truth distinct from falsehood).

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Whoever goes right, then he goes right only for the benefit of himself. And whoever goes astray, then he goes astray at his own loss. No one laden with burdens can bear another's burden. And We never punish until We have sent a Messenger (to give warning).

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Whosoever goeth right, it is only for (the good of) his own soul that he goeth right, and whosoever erreth, erreth only to its hurt. No laden soul can bear another's load, We never punish until we have sent a messenger.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Whosoever is guided is only guided for his own self, and whosoever goes astray it is only against it. No soul shall bear another's burden. Nor do We punish until we have sent a Messenger.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] his soul. And whoever errs only errs against it. And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. And never would We punish until We sent a messenger.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: One who follows guidance does so for himself and one who goes astray does so against his soul. No one will suffer for the sins of others. We have never punished anyone without sending them Our Messenger first.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Whoever chooses to follow the right path, follows it for his own good; and whoever goes astray, goes astray at his own peril; no bearer of burdens shall bear the burdens of another. Nor do We punish until We have sent forth a messenger to forewarn them.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Who receiveth guidance, receiveth it for his own benefit: who goeth astray doth so to his own loss: No bearer of burdens can bear the burden of another: nor would We visit with Our Wrath until We had sent an messenger (to give warning).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Nothing prevented men from believing when guidance came to them, other than (what) they said: "Has God sent (only) a man as messenger?"

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And what prevented people from believing when the guidance came to them, except their saying that, “What! Allah has sent a human as a Noble Messenger?”?

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And naught prevented men from believing when the guidance came to them, but that they said, 'Has God sent forth a mortal as Messenger?'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And nothing prevented men from believing when the guidance came to them, except that they said: "Has Allah sent a man as (His) Messenger?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Nothing prevented the people from believing, when guidance has come to them, except that they said, “Did God send a human messenger?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Whenever Guidance came to people, nothing prevented them from believing except that they said: "Has Allah sent a human being as a Messenger?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And nothing prevented men from believing when the guidance came to them, except that they said: "Has Allah sent a man as (His) Messenger"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And naught prevented mankind from believing when the guidance came unto them save that they said: Hath Allah sent a mortal as (His) messenger?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Nothing prevented people from believing when guidance came to them but (the excuse): 'Has Allah sent a human as a Messenger'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And what prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them except that they said, "Has Allah sent a human messenger?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: What keeps people from belief that guidance has come to them, but they question, "Why has God sent a mortal Messenger?"

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Nothing has prevented men from believing whenever guidance came to them, save their query, "Has God sent a human being as a messenger?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: What kept men back from belief when Guidance came to them, was nothing but this: they said, "Has Allah sent a man (like us) to be (His) Messenger?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Say: "If angels had peopled the earth and walked about in peace and quiet, We would surely have sent to them an angel as messenger.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Proclaim, “If there were angels walking peacefully on the earth, We would send down only an angel from heaven, as a Noble Messenger towards them.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Say: 'Had there been in the earth angels walking. at peace, We would have sent down upon them out of heaven an angel as Messenger.'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Say: "If there were on the earth, angels walking about in peace and security, We should certainly have sent down for them from the heaven an angel as a Messenger."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Say, “If there were angels on earth, walking around in peace, We would have sent down to them from heaven an angel messenger.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Say: "Had angels been walking about in peace on the earth, We would surely have sent to them an angel from the heavens as Messenger."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Say: "If there were on the earth, angels walking about in peace and security, We should certainly have sent down for them from the heaven an angel as a Messenger."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Say: If there were in the earth angels walking secure, We had sent down for them from heaven an angel as messenger.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Say: 'Had there been angels walking at peace in the earth, We would have sent down an angel from heaven to them as a Messenger'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Say, "If there were upon the earth angels walking securely, We would have sent down to them from the heaven an angel [as a] messenger."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), say, "Had the earth been inhabited by angels who would walk serenely therein, only then would We have sent to them angelic Messengers".

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Say, "If there had been angels walking around on earth, We would have sent an angel down from Heaven as a messenger for them."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Say, "If there were settled, on earth, angels walking about in peace and quiet, We should certainly have sent them down from the heavens an angel for a messenger."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He replied: "I am only a messenger from your Lord (sent) to bestow a good son on you."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: If thou fearest God... He said, 'I am but a messenger come from thy Lord, to give thee a boy most pure.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: (The angel) said: "I am only a Messenger from your Lord, (to announce) to you the gift of a righteous son."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “I am only the messenger of your Lord, to give you the gift of a pure son.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (The angel) said: "I am only a messenger from your Lord, (to announce) to you the gift of a righteous son."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: I am only a messenger of thy Lord, that I may bestow on thee a faultless son.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘I am only a messenger of your Lord that I may give you a pure son.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'I am the Messenger of your Lord' he replied, 'and have come to give you a pure boy'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: He said, "I am only the messenger of your Lord to give you [news of] a pure boy."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He said, "I am the Messengers of your Lord. I have come to give you a purified son".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: He said: I am only a messenger of your Lord: That I will give you a pure boy.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: "I am only the messenger of your Lord," he replied. "I shall bestow upon you the gift of a son endowed with purity."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: He said: "Nay, I am only a messenger from thy Lord, (to announce) to thee the gift of a holy son.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Commemorate Ishmael in the Book. He was true of his promise, and a messenger, a prophet.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And remember Ismail in the Book; he was indeed true to his promise and was a Noble Messenger, a Prophet.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And mention in the Book Ishmael; he was true to his promise, and he was a Messenger, a Prophet.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And mention in the Book (the Quran) Isma'il (Ishmael). Verily! He was true to what he promised, and he was a Messenger, (and) a Prophet.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And mention in the Scripture Ishmael. He was true to his promise, and was a messenger, a prophet.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And recite in the Book the account of Ishmael. He was ever true to his promise, and was a Messenger, a Prophet.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And mention in the Book, Isma`il. Verily, he was true to what he promised, and he was a Messenger, (and) a Prophet.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And make mention in the Scripture of Ishmael. Lo! he was a keeper of his promise, and he was a messenger (of Allah), a prophet.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And mention in the Book, Ishmael; he too was true to his promise, a Messenger and a Prophet.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And mention in the Book, Ishmael. Indeed, he was true to his promise, and he was a messenger and a prophet.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Mention in the Book (the Quran) the story of Ishmael; he was true to his promise, a Messengers and a Prophet.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Tell also of Ishmael in the Book. He was true to his promise and was a messenger and a prophet.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Also mention in the Book (the story of) Isma'il: He was (strictly) true to what he promised, and he was a messenger (and) a prophet.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: If We had destroyed them by some calamity sooner than this, they would have surely said: "O Lord, if You had sent to us a messenger we would have followed Your command before being humbled and disgraced."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And had We destroyed them with some punishment before the advent of a Noble Messenger, they would have certainly said, “Our Lord, why did You not send a Noble Messenger to us, so we would have followed Your signs, before being humiliated and disgraced?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Had We destroyed them with a chastisement aforetime, they would have said, 'Our Lord, why didst Thou not send us a Messenger, so that we might have followed Thy signs before that we were humiliated and degraded?'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And if We had destroyed them with a torment before this (i.e. Messenger Muhammad SAW and the Quran), they would surely have said: "Our Lord! If only You had sent us a Messenger, we should certainly have followed Your Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.), before we were humiliated and disgraced."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Had We destroyed them with a punishment before him, they would have said, “Our Lord, if only You had sent us a messenger, we would have followed Your revelations before we were humiliated and disgraced.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Had We destroyed them through some calamity before his coming, they would have said: "Our Lord! Why did You not send any Messenger to us that we might have followed Your signs before being humbled and disgraced?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And if We had destroyed them with a torment before this, they would surely have said: "Our Lord! If only You had sent us a Messenger we should certainly have followed Your Ayat, before we were humiliated and disgraced."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And if we had destroyed them with some punishment before it, they would assuredly have said: Our Lord! If only Thou hadst sent unto us a messenger, so that we might have followed Thy revelations before we were (thus) humbled and disgraced!

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Had We destroyed them with a punishment before this, they would have said: 'Our Lord, why did You not send us a Messenger so that we could have followed Your verses before we were humiliated and degraded'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And if We had destroyed them with a punishment before him, they would have said, "Our Lord, why did You not send to us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses before we were humiliated and disgraced?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Had We destroyed them with a torment before the coming of Muhammad they would have said, "Lord, would that you had sent us a Messengers so that we could have followed Your revelations before being humiliated and disgraced."

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: If We had destroyed them with a punishment before this, they would have surely said, "Our Lord, why did you not send to us a messenger so that we might have followed Your commandment before we were humiliated and disgraced?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And if We had inflicted on them a penalty before this, they would have said: "Our Lord! If only Thou hadst sent us a messenger, we should certainly have followed Thy Signs before we were humbled and put to shame."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We have sent no messenger or apostle before you with whose recitations Satan did not tamper. Yet God abrogates what Satan interpolates; then He confirms His revelations, for God is all-knowing and all-wise.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And all the Noble Messengers or Prophets whom We sent before you – it occurred with all of them – that whenever they recited (the message) Satan included a bit (from his own speech) in their recitation to the people; so Allah obliterates what Satan includes and then Allah fortifies His verses; and Allah is All Knowing, Wise.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: We sent not ever any Messenger or Prophet before thee, but that Satan cast into his fancy, when he was fancying; but God annuls what Satan casts, then God confirms His signs -- surely God is All-knowing, All-wise --

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Never did We send a Messenger or a Prophet before you, but; when he did recite the revelation or narrated or spoke, Shaitan (Satan) threw (some falsehood) in it. But Allah abolishes that which Shaitan (Satan) throws in. Then Allah establishes His Revelations. And Allah is All-Knower, All-Wise:

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We never sent a messenger before you, or a prophet, but when he had a desire Satan interfered in his wishes. But God nullifies what Satan interjects, and God affirms His revelations. God is Omniscient and Wise.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Never did We send a Messenger or a Prophet before you (O Muhammad), but that whenever he had a desire, Satan interfered with that desire. Allah eradicates the interference of Satan and strengthens His Signs. Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Never did We send a Messenger or a Prophet before you but when he did recite (the revelation or narrated or spoke), Shaytan threw (some falsehood) in his recitation (of the revelation). But Yansakh Allah that which Shaytan throws in. Then Allah establishes His revelations. And Allah is All-Knower, All-Wise:

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Never sent We a messenger or a prophet before thee but when He recited (the message) Satan proposed (opposition) in respect of that which he recited thereof. But Allah abolisheth that which Satan proposeth. Then Allah establisheth His revelations. Allah is Knower, Wise;

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Never have We sent a Messenger or a Prophet before you, but when he hoped, satan tampered with his hope. But Allah supersedes the tampering of satan and confirms His verses. And Allah is the Knower, the Wise.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We did not send before you any messenger or prophet except that when he spoke [or recited], Satan threw into it [some misunderstanding]. But Allah abolishes that which Satan throws in; then Allah makes precise His verses. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Satan would try to tamper with the desires of every Prophet or Messenger whom We sent. Then God would remove Satan's temptations and strengthen His revelations. God is All-knowing and All-wise.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Whenever We sent any messenger or prophet before you, and he recited anything [of Our revelation], Satan tampered with it. But God abrogates Satan's interjections and then He firmly reaffirms His revelations. God is all knowing and all wise.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Never did We send a messenger or a prophet before thee, but, when he framed a desire, Satan threw some (vanity) into his desire: but Allah will cancel anything (vain) that Satan throws in, and Allah will confirm (and establish) His Signs: for Allah is full of Knowledge and Wisdom:

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Say: "Obey God and obey the Apostle. If you turn away, then for him is his duty to fulfil, and for you the burden that you carry; yet if you obey him you will be rightly guided. The duty of the Messenger is to convey the message clearly.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Proclaim, “Obey Allah and obey the Noble Messenger; so if you turn away, then the Noble Messenger is bound only for what is obligatory upon him, and upon you is the duty placed upon you”; and if you obey the Noble Messenger, you will attain guidance; and the Noble Messenger is not liable except to plainly convey.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Say: 'Obey God, and obey the Messenger; then, if you turn away, only upon him rests what is laid on him, and upon you rests what is laid on you. If you obey him, you will be guided. It is only for the Messenger to deliver the manifest Message.'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Say: "Obey Allah and obey the Messenger, but if you turn away, he (Messenger Muhammad SAW) is only responsible for the duty placed on him (i.e. to convey Allah's Message) and you for that placed on you. If you obey him, you shall be on the right guidance. The Messenger's duty is only to convey (the message) in a clear way (i.e. to preach in a plain way)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Say, “Obey God and obey the Messenger.” But if they turn away, then he is responsible for his obligations, and you are responsible for your obligations. And if you obey him, you will be guided. It is only incumbent on the Messenger to deliver the Clarifying Message.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Say, "Obey Allah and obey the Messenger, but if you turn away, you should note it well that the Messenger is responsible for the duty entrusted to him and you are responsible for the duty entrusted to you. If you obey him, you will be rightly guided, for the responsibility of the Messenger is only to convey the Message clearly to you.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Say: "Obey Allah and obey the Messenger, but if you turn away, he is only responsible for the duty placed on him and you for that placed on you. If you obey him, you shall be on the right guidance. The Messenger's duty is only to convey (the Message) in a clear way.") Allah says about the hypocrites who had promised the Messenger and sworn that if he were to command them to go out for battle, they would go:

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Say: Obey Allah and obey the messenger. But if ye turn away, then (it is) for him (to do) only that wherewith he hath been charged, and for you (to do) only that wherewith ye have been charged. If ye obey him, ye will go aright. But the messenger hath no other charge than to convey (the message) plainly.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Say: 'Obey Allah and obey the Messenger. If you turn away, upon him only rests what is laid upon him, and upon you rests what is laid on you. If you obey him, you shall be guided. It is only for the Messenger to deliver a clear message'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Say, "Obey Allah and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away - then upon him is only that [duty] with which he has been charged, and upon you is that with which you have been charged. And if you obey him, you will be [rightly] guided. And there is not upon the Messenger except the [responsibility for] clear notification."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Say to them, "Obey God and His Messenger. If you turn away, the Messenger and the people will each be responsible for their own obligations. If you follow the Messenger, you will have the right guidance. The responsibility of the Messenger is only to preach."

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Obey God and obey the Messenger. If you turn away, then he is responsible for what he is charged with and you are responsible for what you are charged with. If you obey him, you will be rightly guided. The Messenger is responsible only for delivering the message clearly.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Say: "Obey Allah, and obey the Messenger: but if ye turn away, he is only responsible for the duty placed on him and ye for that placed on you. If ye obey him, ye shall be on right guidance. The Messenger's duty is only to preach the clear (Message).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When they see you they take you only in jest: "Is this the one whom God has sent as messenger?

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And when they see you (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) they take you but as a mockery, “Is this the one whom Allah sent as a (Noble) Messenger?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And when they see thee, they take thee in mockery only: 'What, is this he whom God sent forth as a Messenger?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And when they see you (O Muhammad SAW), they treat you only as a mockery (saying):"Is this the one whom Allah has sent as a Messenger?

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And when they see you, they take you for nothing but mockery: “Is this the one God sent as a messenger?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: When these people see you, they scoff at you, (saying), "Is this the man whom Allah has sent as His Messenger?

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And when they see you, they treat you only in mockery (saying): "Is this the one whom Allah has sent as a Messenger"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when they see thee (O Muhammad) they treat thee only as a jest (saying): Is this he whom Allah sendeth as a messenger?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Whenever they see you, they mock you (saying): 'Is this whom Allah has sent as a Messenger?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And when they see you, [O Muhammad], they take you not except in ridicule, [saying], "Is this the one whom Allah has sent as a messenger?

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), when they see you, they will only mock you and say, "Has God really sent him as a Messengers?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Whenever they see you they only make a mockery of you -- "Is this the one God has sent as His Messenger?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: When they see thee, they treat thee no otherwise than in mockery: "Is this the one whom Allah has sent as a messenger?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: I have been sent as a trusted messenger to you.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “I am indeed a trustworthy Noble Messenger of Allah to you.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: I am for you a faithful Messenger,

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: I am to you a faithful messenger.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: I am a trustworthy Messenger to you;

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "I am a trustworthy Messenger to you."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: I am for you an honest Messenger,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: I am a trustworthy Messengers sent to you.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: I am a trustworthy messenger for you:

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "I am to you a messenger worthy of all trust:

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: I am for you a faithful Messenger, so fear you God, and obey you me.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "I am to you a messenger worthy of all trust.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Said Firaun, “This (Noble) Messenger of yours, who has been sent towards you, has no intelligence!”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Said he, 'Surely your Messenger who was sent to you is possessed!'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "Verily, your Messenger who has been sent to you is a madman!"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He said, “This messenger of yours, who is sent to you, is crazy.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Pharaoh said to the audience: "This Messenger of yours who has been sent to you is simply mad."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (Fir`awn) said: "Verily, your Messenger who has been sent to you is a madman!"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: Lo! your messenger who hath been sent unto you is indeed a madman!

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘Indeed your messenger, who has been sent to you, is surely crazy!’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: 'Surely, the Messenger who has been sent to you is mad!'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Pharaoh] said, "Indeed, your 'messenger' who has been sent to you is mad."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Pharaoh said, "The Messengers who has been sent to you is certainly insane".

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Pharaoh said, "This messenger who has been sent to you is surely possessed!"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Pharaoh) said: "Truly your messenger who has been sent to you is a veritable madman!"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When a messenger was sent to them by God affirming the Books they had already received, some of them put (His message) behind their backs as if they had no knowledge of it.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And when a Noble Messenger from Allah came to them, confirming the Book(s) which they possessed, a group of those who have received the Book(s) flung the Book of Allah behind their backs as if they were totally unaware!

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: When there has come to them a Messenger from God confirming what was with them, a party of them that were given the Book reject the Book of God behind their backs, as though they knew not,

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And when there came to them a Messenger from Allah (i.e. Muhammad Peace be upon him) confirming what was with them, a party of those who were given the Scripture threw away the Book of Allah behind their backs as if they did not know!

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And when there came to them a messenger from God, confirming what they had, a faction of those who were given the Book threw the Book of God behind their backs, as if they do not know.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And whenever a Messenger came to them from Allah, confirming that Scripture which they already possessed, some from among the people of the Book threw the Book of Allah behind their backs as though they knew nothing about it.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And when there came to them a Messenger from Allah (i.e. Muhammad) confirming what was with them, a party of those who were given the Scripture threw away the Book of Allah behind their backs as if they did not know!

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when there cometh unto them a messenger from Allah, confirming that which they possess, a party of those who have received the Scripture fling the Scripture of Allah behind their backs as if they knew not,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And now that a Messenger has come to them from Allah confirming what was with them, some of those to whom the Book was given reject the Book of Allah behind their backs, as though they knew nothing

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And when a messenger from Allah came to them confirming that which was with them, a party of those who had been given the Scripture threw the Scripture of Allah behind their backs as if they did not know [what it contained].

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When a Messenger of God came to them confirming the (original) revelation that they already had received, a group of those who had the Scripture with them, threw the Book of God behind their backs as if they did not know anything about it.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Whenever a messenger from God has come to them, fulfilling that [predictions] which they already had, some of those to whom the Book was given have cast off the Book of God behind their backs as if they had no knowledge.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And when there came to them a messenger from Allah, confirming what was with them, a party of the people of the Book threw away the Book of Allah behind their backs, as if (it had been something) they did not know!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Even as We sent a messenger from among you to convey Our messages to you and cleanse you, and teach you the Book and the wisdom, and what you did not know;

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: The way We have sent to you a Noble Messenger from among you, who recites to you Our verses and purifies you, and teaches you the Book and sound wisdom*, and teaches you what you did not know. (The traditions / sayings of the Holy Prophet – peace and blessings be upon him).

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: as also We have sent among you, of yourselves, a Messenger, to recite Our signs to you and to purify you, and to teach you the Book and the Wisdom, and to teach you that you knew not.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Similarly (to complete My Blessings on you) We have sent among you a Messenger (Muhammad SAW) of your own, reciting to you Our Verses (the Quran) and sanctifying you, and teaching you the Book (the Quran) and the Hikmah (i.e. Sunnah, Islamic laws and Fiqh - jurisprudence), and teaching you that which you used not to know.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Just as We sent to you a messenger from among you, who recites Our revelations to you, and purifies you, and teaches you the Book and wisdom, and teaches you what you did not know.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: just as (you have found from this: that) We sent the Messenger to you from among you, who recites to you Our Revelations; who purifies your lives; who instructs you in the Book and in Wisdom and teaches you those things that you did not know.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Similarly (to complete My blessings on you), We have sent among you a Messenger (Muhammad) of your own, reciting to you Our verses (the Qur'an) and purifying you, and teaching you the Book (the Qur'an) and the Hikmah (i.e., Sunnah, Islamic laws and Fiqh ـ jurisprudence), and teaching you that which you did not know.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Even as We have sent unto you a messenger from among you, who reciteth unto you Our revelations and causeth you to grow, and teacheth you the Scripture and wisdom, and teacheth you that which ye knew not.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: As We have sent among you a Messenger (Prophet Muhammad) from yourselves, to recite to you Our verses and to purify you, who will teach you the Book and Wisdom, and teach you that of which you have no knowledge.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Just as We have sent among you a messenger from yourselves reciting to you Our verses and purifying you and teaching you the Book and wisdom and teaching you that which you did not know.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: As We have sent a Messenger from your own people to show you evidence about Me, to purify you from sins, to teach you the Book, give you wisdom and instruct you in that which you did not know,

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Thus We have sent among you a Messenger of your own to recite Our revelations to you, purify you and teach you the Book and wisdom, and to teach you what you did not know.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: A similar (favour have ye already received) in that We have sent among you a Messenger of your own, rehearsing to you Our Signs, and sanctifying you, and instructing you in Scripture and Wisdom, and in new knowledge.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Remember We gave Moses the Book and sent after him many an apostle; and to Jesus, son of Mary, We gave clear evidence of the truth, reinforcing him with divine grace. Even so, when a messenger brought to you what did not suit your mood you turned haughty, and called some imposters and some others you slew.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And indeed We gave Moosa (Moses) the Book and subsequent to him, sent Noble Messengers one after another – and We gave Eisa (Jesus), the son of Maryam (Mary), clear proofs and supported him with the Holy Spirit; so when a Noble Messenger from Allah comes to you bringing what you yourselves do not desire, you grow arrogant; so you disbelieve in a group of the Prophets and another group of Prophets you slay!

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We gave to Moses the Book, and after him sent succeeding Messengers; and We gave Jesus son of Mary the clear signs, and confirmed him with the Holy Spirit; and whensoever there came to you a Messenger with that your souls had not desire for, did you become arrogant, and some cry lies to, and some slay?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed, We gave Musa (Moses) the Book and followed him up with a succession of Messengers. And We gave 'Iesa (Jesus), the son of Maryam (Mary), clear signs and supported him with Ruh-ul-Qudus [Jibrael (Gabriel)]. Is it that whenever there came to you a Messenger with what you yourselves desired not, you grew arrogant? Some, you disbelieved and some, you killed.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We gave Moses the Scripture, and sent a succession of messengers after him. And We gave Jesus son of Mary the clear proofs, and We supported him with the Holy Spirit. Is it that whenever a messenger comes to you with anything your souls do not desire, you grew arrogant, calling some impostors, and killing others?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And We gave Moses the Book and sent after him a train of Messengers in succession. Then We sent Jesus, son of Mary, with clear Signs and supported him with the Holy Spirit. Then how is it that whenever a Messenger came to you wish that which did not suit your lusts, you grew rebellious against him, and repudiated some and slew others.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And indeed, We gave Musa the Book and followed him up with a succession of Messengers. And We gave `Isa, the son of Maryam, clear signs and supported him with Ruh-il-Qudus. Is it that whenever there came to you a Messenger with what you yourselves desired not, you grew arrogant Some you disbelieved and some you killed.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And verily We gave unto Moses the Scripture and We caused a train of messengers to follow after him, and We gave unto Jesus, son of Mary, clear proofs (of Allah's sovereignty), and We supported him with the Holy spirit. Is it ever so, that, when there cometh unto you a messenger (from Allah) with that which ye yourselves desire not, ye grow arrogant, and some ye disbelieve and some ye slay?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: To Moses We gave the Book and after him We sent other Messengers. We gave (Prophet) Jesus, the son of Mary, veritable signs, and supported him with the Spirit of Purity (Gabriel). Will you then become proud whenever any Messenger comes to you with that which does not suit your fancies, and you belied some (Prophet Jesus) and killed others!

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We did certainly give Moses the Torah and followed up after him with messengers. And We gave Jesus, the son of Mary, clear proofs and supported him with the Pure Spirit. But is it [not] that every time a messenger came to you, [O Children of Israel], with what your souls did not desire, you were arrogant? And a party [of messengers] you denied and another party you killed.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We gave the Book to Moses and made the Messengers follow in his path. To Jesus, the son of Mary, We gave the miracles and supported him by the Holy Spirit. Why do you arrogantly belie some Messengers and murder others whenever they have brought you messages that you dislike?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: To Moses We gave the Book and sent a succession of messengers after him. We gave Jesus, son of Mary, clear signs and strengthened him with the Holy Spirit. But, whenever a messenger came to you with something which you did not desire, you grew arrogant, calling some liars and slaying others.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We gave Moses the Book and followed him up with a succession of messengers; We gave Jesus the son of Mary Clear (Signs) and strengthened him with the holy spirit. Is it that whenever there comes to you a messenger with what ye yourselves desire not, ye are puffed up with pride?- Some ye called impostors, and others ye slay!

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: If they call you a liar, so have other messengers been denied before you. But all things will be brought back to God.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And if they deny you, many Noble Messengers were denied before you; and towards Allah only is the return of all matters.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: If they cry lies to thee, Messengers before thee were cried lies to; and unto God all matters are returned.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And if they belie you (O Muhammad SAW), so were Messengers belied before you. And to Allah return all matters (for decision).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: If they reject you, messengers before you were also rejected. To God all matters are returned.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (O Prophet), (there is nothing novel in it) if they cry lies to you; Messengers before you were also cried lies to. To Allah shall all matters be sent back.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And if they deny you, so were Messengers denied before you. And to Allah return all matters.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And if they deny thee, (O Muhammad), messengers (of Allah) were denied before thee. Unto Allah all things are brought back.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: If they belie you, other Messengers have been belied before you. To Allah all matters are returned.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And if they deny you, [O Muhammad] - already were messengers denied before you. And to Allah are returned [all] matters.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: If they reject you, other Messengers had certainly been rejected before you. All decisions are in the hands of God.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: If they reject you, other messengers have been rejected before you. To God all affairs will be returned.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And if they reject thee, so were messengers rejected before thee: to Allah back for decision all affairs.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Of all these there was not one who did not deny the messengers. So My retribution was justified.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: None of them was such that it did not deny the Noble Messengers, therefore My punishment became inevitable.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: not one, that cried not lies to the Messengers, so My retribution was just.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Not one of them but belied the Messengers, therefore My Torment was justified,

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: None of them but denied the messengers, so My retribution was deserved.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Each of them gave the lie to Messengers and My decree of chastisement came upon them.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Not one of them but denied the Messengers; therefore My torment was justified.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Not one of them but did deny the messengers, therefor My doom was justified,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: There was not one of those that did not belie the Messengers. Therefore, My retribution was realized.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Each of them denied the messengers, so My penalty was justified.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Each of them who rejected the Messenger become subject to Our punishment.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: There was not one of them but treated their messengers as liars, so My punishment rightly overtook them:

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Not one (of them) but rejected the messengers, but My punishment came justly and inevitably (on them).

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Those who obeyed the call of God and His Messenger, even after they were wounded, and took heed for themselves, shall indeed have an ample reward,

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Those who responded to the call of Allah and His Noble Messenger after they had been grieved; for the virtuous and the pious among them is a great reward.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And those who answered God and the Messenger after the wound had smitten them - to all those of them who did good and feared God, shall be a mighty wage;

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Those who answered (the Call of) Allah and the Messenger (Muhammad SAW) after being wounded; for those of them who did good deeds and feared Allah, there is a great reward.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Those who responded to God and the Messenger, despite the persecution they had suffered. For the virtuous and the pious among them is a great reward.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: There were those who responded to the call of Allah and the Messenger after injury had smitten them - for all those who do good and fear Allah there is a mighty reward.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Those who answered (the Call of) Allah and the Messenger after being wounded; for those of them who did good deeds and feared Allah, there is a great reward.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: As for those who heard the call of Allah and His messenger after the harm befell them (in the fight); for such of them as do right and ward off (evil), there is great reward.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Those who answered Allah and the Messenger after the wound had afflicted them, for those of them who did good and were cautious there is a great wage.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Those [believers] who responded to Allah and the Messenger after injury had struck them. For those who did good among them and feared Allah is a great reward -

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The righteous and pious of those who have pledged obedience to God and the Messenger, after injury had befallen them, will receive a great reward.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Those who responded to the call of God and the Messenger, despite their having received an injury, and such of them as did good deeds and feared God, shall have a great reward.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Of those who answered the call of Allah and the Messenger, even after being wounded, those who do right and refrain from wrong have a great reward;-

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Indeed the only true religion in the sight of Allah is Islam; those who had received the Books differed only after the knowledge came to them, due to their hearts’ envy; and whoever disbelieves in the signs of Allah, then Allah is Swift At Taking Account.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: The true religion with God is Islam. Those who were given the Book were not at variance except after the knowledge came to them, being insolent one to another. And whoso disbelieves in God's signs. God is swift at the reckoning.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Verily the religion with Allah is Islam and those Who Were vouchsafed the Book differed Not save after the knowledge had come unto them, out of spite among themselves. And whosoever disbelieveth in the revelations of Allah, then verily Allah swift at reckoning.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Truly, the religion with Allah is Islam. Those who were given the Scripture (Jews and Christians) did not differ except, out of mutual jealousy, after knowledge had come to them. And whoever disbelieves in the Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, signs, revelations, etc.) of Allah, then surely, Allah is Swift in calling to account.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Religion with God is Islam. Those to whom the Scripture was given differed only after knowledge came to them, out of envy among themselves. Whoever rejects the signs of God—God is quick to take account.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: The true religion with Allah is Islam. The People of the Book adopted many different ways rather than follow the true way of Islam even after the knowledge of truth had reached them, and this merely to commit excesses against one another. Let him who refuses to follow the ordinances and directives of Allah know that Allah is swift in His reckoning.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Truly, the religion with Allah is Islam. Those who were given the Scripture (Jews and Christians) did not differ except out of rivalry, after knowledge had come to them. And whoever disbelieves in the Ayat of Allah, then surely, Allah is Swift in reckoning.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Indeed, with Allah religion is Islam, and those who were given the Book did not differ except after knowledge had come to them, out of envy among themselves. And whoever denies Allah’s signs [should know that] Allah is swift at reckoning.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: The only religion with Allah is Islam (submission). Those to whom the Book was given disagreed among themselves only after knowledge had been given to them being insolent among themselves. He who disbelieves the verses of Allah indeed Allah is Swift in reckoning.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Indeed, the religion in the sight of Allah is Islam. And those who were given the Scripture did not differ except after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. And whoever disbelieves in the verses of Allah, then indeed, Allah is swift in [taking] account.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: In the sight of God Islam is the religion. The People of the Book created differences in the matters (of religion) because of their hostility among themselves, only after knowledge had come to them. Let whoever denies the revelations of God know that the reckoning of God is swift.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Surely the (true) religion with Allah is Islam, and those to whom the Book had been given did not show opposition but after knowledge had come to them, out of envy among themselves; and whoever disbelieves in the communications of Allah then surely Allah is quick in reckoning.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: The Religion before Allah is Islam (submission to His Will): Nor did the People of the Book dissent therefrom except through envy of each other, after knowledge had come to them. But if any deny the Signs of Allah, Allah is swift in calling to account.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Say: "Obey God and His Messenger;" and if they refuse (then remember) God does not love disbelievers.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Proclaim, “Obey Allah and the Noble Messenger”; so if they turn away – then Allah is not pleased with the disbelievers.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Say: 'Obey God, and the Messenger.' But if they turn their backs, God loves not the unbelievers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Say (O Muhammad SAW): "Obey Allah and the Messenger (Muhammad SAW)." But if they turn away, then Allah does not like the disbelievers.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Say, “Obey God and the Messenger.” But if they turn away—God does not love the faithless.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Say: 'Obey Allah and obey the Messenger.' If they turn away from this then know that Allah does not love those who refuse to obey Him and His Messenger.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Say: "Obey Allah and the Messenger." But if they turn away, then Allah does not like the disbelievers.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Say: Obey Allah and the messenger. But if they turn away, lo! Allah loveth not the disbelievers (in His guidance).

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Say: 'Obey Allah and the Messenger' But if they turn away, then truly, Allah does not love the unbelievers.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Say, "Obey Allah and the Messenger." But if they turn away - then indeed, Allah does not like the disbelievers.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Tell them, "Obey God and the Messenger." If they turn away (let it be known) that God does not love the unbelievers.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Say, "Obey God and the Messenger," and if they turn away, God does not love those who deny the truth.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Say: "Obey Allah and His Messenger": But if they turn back, Allah loveth not those who reject Faith.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: We will certainly help Our messengers and those who believe, in this world, and on the day the witnesses take their stand,

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Indeed We will surely help Our Noble Messengers, and the believers, in the life of this world and on the day when the witnesses will be standing.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Surely We shall help Our Messengers and those who have believed, in the present life, and upon the day when the witnesses arise,

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Verily, We will indeed make victorious Our Messengers and those who believe (in the Oneness of Allah Islamic Monotheism) in this world's life and on the Day when the witnesses will stand forth, (i.e. Day of Resurrection),

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Most surely We will support Our messengers and those who believe, in this life, and on the Day the witnesses arise.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Surely We shall help Our Messengers and the believers in the life of this world and on the Day when witnesses will rise to testify,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Verily, We will indeed make victorious Our Messengers and those who believe in this world's life and on the Day when the witnesses will stand forth, --

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Lo! We verily do help Our messengers, and those who believe, in the life of the world and on the day when the witnesses arise,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Surely, We shall help Our Messengers and the believers both in this world and on the Day when the witnesses rise.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Indeed, We will support Our messengers and those who believe during the life of this world and on the Day when the witnesses will stand -

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We shall help Our Messengers and the believers, in this life and on the day when witness will come forward.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Most surely We help our messengers, and those who believe, in the life of this world and on the Day when all the witnesses will stand up.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We will, without doubt, help our messengers and those who believe, (both) in this world's life and on the Day when the Witnesses will stand forth,-

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: "Deliver the creatures of God to me. I am the trusted messenger sent to you.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Who said, “Give the bondmen of Allah into my custody; I am indeed a trustworthy Noble Messenger for you.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: saying, 'Deliver to me God's servants; I am for you a faithful Messenger,

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Saying: "Restore to me the slaves of Allah (i.e. the Children of Israel). Verily! I am to you a Messenger worthy of all trust,

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Saying, “Hand over God’s servants to me. I am an honest messenger to you.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (and said): “Deliver to me Allah's servants. I am a trustworthy Messenger to you,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Saying: "Deliver to me the servants of Allah. Verily, I am to you a Messenger worthy of all trust."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Saying: Give up to me the slaves of Allah. Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: (saying:) 'Be obedient to me O worshipers of Allah. I am your honest Messenger.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Saying], "Render to me the servants of Allah. Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger,"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: "Send the servants of God with me. I am a trustworthy Messenger sent to you.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: saying, "Hand over God's servants to me. I am a trustworthy messenger for you.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Saying: "Restore to me the Servants of Allah: I am to you an messenger worthy of all trust;

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Say: "I am not a new Messenger to come, nor do I know what is to be done to me or you. I only follow what is revealed to me. My duty is only to warn you clearly."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Say, “I am not something new* among the Noble Messengers, nor do I know (on my own) what will happen to me** or with you; I only follow that which is divinely revealed to me, and I am purely a Herald of clear warning. (* I am like the earlier ones. ** My knowledge comes due to divine revelations.)

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Say: 'I am not an innovation among the Messengers, and I know not what shall be done with me or with you. I only follow what is revealed to me; I am only a clear warner.'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Say (O Muhammad SAW):"I am not a new thing among the Messengers (of Allah) (i.e. I am not the first Messenger) nor do I know what will be done with me or with you. I only follow that which is revealed to me, and I am but a plain warner."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Say, “I am not different from the other messengers; and I do not know what will be done with me, or with you. I only follow what is inspired in me, and I am only a clear warner.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Tell them: “I am not the first of the Messengers; and I do not know what shall be done with me or with you. I follow only what is revealed to me, and I am nothing but a plain warner.”

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Say: "I am not a new thing among the Messengers, nor do I know what will be done with me or you. I only follow that which is revealed to me, and I am but a plain warner."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Say: I am no new thing among the messengers (of Allah), nor know I what will be done with me or with you. I do but follow that which is inspired in me, and I am but a plain warner.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Say: 'I am not an innovation among the Messengers; nor know what will be done with me or you. I follow only what is revealed to me; I am only a clearwarner'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Say, "I am not something original among the messengers, nor do I know what will be done with me or with you. I only follow that which is revealed to me, and I am not but a clear warner."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Say, "I am not the first Messenger. I do not know what will be done to me or to you. I follow only what has been revealed to me and my duty is only to give clear warning".

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Say, "I am not the first of God's messengers, and I do not know what will be done with me or with you: I do not follow anything but what is revealed to me, and I am merely a plain warner."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Say: "I am no bringer of new-fangled doctrine among the messengers, nor do I know what will be done with me or with you. I follow but that which is revealed to me by inspiration; I am but a Warner open and clear."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: The ignorant said, “We have accepted faith”; say, (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), “You have surely not accepted faith, but you should say ‘We have submitted’, for faith has not yet entered your hearts; and if you obey* Allah and His Noble Messenger, He will not reduce the reward of any of your deeds; indeed Allah is Oft Forgiving, Most Merciful.” (* By accepting faith and then obeying the commands).

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: The Bedouins say, 'We believe.' Say: 'You do not believe; rather say, "We surrender"; for belief has not yet entered your hearts. If you obey God and His Messenger, He will not diminish you anything of your works. God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: The bedouins say: "We believe." Say: "You believe not but you only say, 'We have surrendered (in Islam),' for Faith has not yet entered your hearts. But if you obey Allah and His Messenger (SAW), He will not decrease anything in reward for your deeds. Verily, Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: The Desert-Arabs say, “We have believed.” Say, “You have not believed; but say, ‘We have submitted,’ for faith has not yet entered into your hearts. But if you obey God and His Messenger, He will not diminish any of your deeds. God is Forgiving and Merciful.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: The Bedouins say: “We believe.” (O Prophet), say to them: “You do not believe; you should rather say: 'We have submitted'”; for belief has not yet entered your hearts. If you obey Allah and His Messenger, He will not diminish anything from the reward of any of your deeds. Surely Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: The bedouins say: "We believe." Say: "You do not believe. But say, `We have submitted,' for Faith has not yet entered your hearts. But if you obey Allah and His Messenger, He will not decrease anything in reward for your deeds. Verily, Allah is Forgiving, Most Merciful."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: The wandering Arabs say: We believe. Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Ye believe not, but rather say "We submit," for the faith hath not yet entered into your hearts. Yet, if ye obey Allah and His messenger, He will not withhold from you aught of (the reward of) your deeds. Lo! Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: The Bedouins say, ‘We have faith.’ Say, ‘You do not have faith yet; rather, say, ‘‘We have embraced Islam,’’ for faith has not yet entered into your hearts. Yet if you obey Allah and His Apostle, He will not stint anything of [the reward of] your works. Indeed Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: The Arabs declare: 'We believe' Say: 'You do not', rather, say: 'we submit' because belief has not yet found its way into your hearts. If you obey Allah and His Messenger, He will not reduce a thing from of your deeds. Allah is the Forgiving and the Most Merciful.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: The bedouins say, "We have believed." Say, "You have not [yet] believed; but say [instead], 'We have submitted,' for faith has not yet entered your hearts. And if you obey Allah and His Messenger, He will not deprive you from your deeds of anything. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The bedouin Arabs have said, "We are believers." Tell them, "You are not believers, but you should say that you are Muslims. In fact, belief has not yet entered your hearts. If you obey God and His Messenger, nothing will be reduced from your deeds. God is All-forgiving and All-merciful.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: The Arabs of the desert say, "We have believed." Say to them, "You have not believed yet; say rather, "We have submitted," for faith has not yet entered into your hearts. But if you will obey God and His Messenger, He will not detract anything from your good deeds. God is most forgiving and ever merciful."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: The desert Arabs say, "We believe." Say, "Ye have no faith; but ye (only) say, 'We have submitted our wills to Allah,' For not yet has Faith entered your hearts. But if ye obey Allah and His Messenger, He will not belittle aught of your deeds: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful."

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Whosoever leaves his country in duty to God will find many places of refuge, and abundance on the earth. And he who leaves his home and becomes an emigre in the way of God and His Messenger, and death overtake him, is sure to receive his reward from God; for God is forgiving and kind.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Whoever migrates for Allah's cause will find much shelter and abundant capacity in the earth; and whoever leaves his home, migrating towards Allah and His Noble Messenger, and death seizes him, his reward then lies entrusted with Allah; and Allah is Oft Forgiving, Most Merciful.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Whoso emigrates in the way of God will find in the earth many refuges and plenty; whoso goes forth from his house an emigrant to God and His Messenger, and then death overtakes him, his wage shall have fallen on God; surely God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: He who emigrates (from his home) in the Cause of Allah, will find on earth many dwelling places and plenty to live by. And whosoever leaves his home as an emigrant unto Allah and His Messenger, and death overtakes him, his reward is then surely incumbent upon Allah. And Allah is Ever Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Anyone who emigrates for the sake of God will find on earth many places of refuge, and plentitude. Anyone who leaves his home, emigrating to God and His Messenger, and then is overtaken by death, his compensation falls on God. God is Forgiver, Most Merciful.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: He who emigrates in the way of Allah will find in the earth enough room for refuge and plentiful resources.
