translation.text: And verily We sent messengers (to mankind) before thee, and We appointed for them wives and offspring, and it was not (given) to any messenger that he should bring a portent save by Allah's leave. For everything there is a time prescribed.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We have sent forth other Messengers before you and given them wives and descendants. Yet none of them could bring a sign except by the permission of Allah. Every term has its Book.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We have already sent messengers before you and assigned to them wives and descendants. And it was not for a messenger to come with a sign except by permission of Allah. For every term is a decree.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent Messengers before you (Muhammad) and gave them wives and offspring. No Messenger was to show miracles without the permission of God.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We sent down messengers before you and gave them wives and children. Yet it was not possible for a messenger to bring a sign, save by the command of God. Every age has had its revelation.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: We did send messengers before thee, and appointed for them wives and children: and it was never the part of a messenger to bring a sign except as Allah permitted (or commanded). For each period is a Book (revealed).

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Their Noble Messengers said, “What! You doubt concerning Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth? He calls you that He may forgive some of your sins and until the time of death give you a life free from punishment”; they said, “You are just human beings like us; you wish to prevent us from what our forefathers used to worship – therefore now bring some clear proof to us.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Their Messengers said, 'Is there any doubt regarding God, the Originator of the heavens and the earth, who calls you so that He may forgive you your sins, and defer you to a term stated?' They said, 'You are nothing but mortals, like us; you desire to bar us from that our fathers served; then bring us a manifest authority.'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Their Messengers said: "What! Can there be a doubt about Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth? He calls you (to Monotheism and to be obedient to Allah) that He may forgive you of your sins and give you respite for a term appointed." They said: "You are no more than human beings like us! You wish to turn us away from what our fathers used to worship. Then bring us a clear authority i.e. a clear proof of what you say)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Their messengers said, “Is there any doubt about God, Maker of the heavens and the earth? He calls you to forgive you your sins, and to defer you until a stated term.” They said, “You are only humans like us; you want to turn us away from what our ancestors worshiped; so bring us a clear proof.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Their Messengers said: "Can there be any doubt about Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth? He invites you that He may forgive you your sins and grant you respite till an appointed term." They replied: "You are only a human being like ourselves. You seek to prevent us from serving those whom our forefathers have been serving all along. If that is so, produce a clear authority for it."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Their Messengers said: "(What!) Can there be a doubt about Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth He calls you that He may forgive you of your sins and give you respite for a term appointed." They said: "You are no more than human beings like us! You wish to turn us away from what our fathers used to worship. Then bring us a clear authority."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Their messengers said: Can there be doubt concerning Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth? He calleth you that He may forgive you your sins and reprieve you unto an appointed term. They said: Ye are but mortals like us, who would fain turn us away from what our fathers used to worship. Then bring some clear warrant.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Their Messengers said: 'Is there any doubt about Allah, the Originator of the heavens and the earth? He calls you to Him in order that He forgives you your sins and defers you till a stated term' They said: 'You are only mortals like us. You wish to bar us from that which our fathers worshipped. Give us some clear proof.'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Their messengers said, "Can there be doubt about Allah, Creator of the heavens and earth? He invites you that He may forgive you of your sins, and He delays your death for a specified term." They said, "You are not but men like us who wish to avert us from what our fathers were worshipping. So bring us a clear authority."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Messengers asked them, "Could there be any doubt about the existence of God who has created the heavens and the earth? He calls you to Himself to forgive your sins. He gives you respite only until the appointed time." They said, "You are mere mortals like us. What you want is to prevent us from worshipping that which our fathers worshipped. Show us clear proof (if what you say is true)."

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Their messengers said, "Is there any doubt about God, the Originator of the heavens and earth? He calls you to Him in order to forgive you some of your offences and to reprieve you for a specific period." They said, "You are only human beings like ourselves! You want to divert us from what our forefathers have been worshipping, so bring us some clear authority."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Their messengers said: "Is there a doubt about Allah, The Creator of the heavens and the earth? It is He Who invites you, in order that He may forgive you your sins and give you respite for a term appointed!" They said: "Ah! ye are no more than human, like ourselves! Ye wish to turn us away from the (gods) our fathers used to worship: then bring us some clear authority."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Their Noble Messengers said to them, “We are indeed human beings like you, but Allah bestows favour upon whomever He wills, among His bondmen*; it is not our task to bring any proof to you except by the command of Allah; and only upon Allah must the Muslims rely.” (* Therefore Prophets and other men are not equal in status.)

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Their Messengers said to them, 'We are nothing but mortals, like you; but God is gracious unto whomsoever He will of His servants. It is not for us to bring you an authority save by the leave of God; and in God let the believers put all their trust.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Their Messengers said to them: "We are no more than human beings like you, but Allah bestows His Grace to whom He wills of His slaves. It is not ours to bring you an authority (proof) except by the Permission of Allah. And in Allah (Alone) let the believers put their trust.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Their messengers said to them, “We are only humans like you, but God favors whomever He wills from among His servants. We cannot possibly show you any proof, except by leave of God. In God let the faithful put their trust.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Their Messengers told them: "Indeed we are only human beings like yourselves, but Allah bestows His favour on those of His servants whom He wills. It does not lie in our power to produce any authority except by the leave of Allah. It is in Allah that the believers should put their trust.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Their Messengers said to them: "We are no more than human beings like you, but Allah bestows His grace to whom He wills of His servants. It is not ours to bring you an authority (proof) except by the permission of Allah. And in Allah (alone) let the believers put their trust."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Their messengers said unto them: We are but mortals like you, but Allah giveth grace unto whom He will of His slaves. It is not ours to bring you a warrant unless by the permission of Allah. In Allah let believers put their trust!

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Their Messengers said to them: 'We are nothing except humans like you. But Allah bestows His Mercy on those of His worshipers whom He chooses. We cannot give you proof, except with the permission of Allah. In Allah, let believers put their trust.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Their messengers said to them, "We are only men like you, but Allah confers favor upon whom He wills of His servants. It has never been for us to bring you evidence except by permission of Allah. And upon Allah let the believers rely.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Messengers replied, "We are certainly mere mortals like you, but God bestows His favors on whichever of His servants He wants. We can not bring you authority without the permission of God. The faithful should trust in God alone.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Their messengers replied, "We are indeed mortals like yourselves. But God bestows His grace on such of His servants as He chooses. We cannot give you miracles, except by God's leave. In God let true believers put their trust --

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Their messengers said to them: "True, we are human like yourselves, but Allah doth grant His grace to such of his servants as He pleases. It is not for us to bring you an authority except as Allah permits. And on Allah let all men of faith put their trust.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And the disbelievers said to their Noble Messengers, “We will surely expel you from our land, unless you accept our religion”; so their Lord sent them the divine revelation that, “Indeed We will destroy these unjust people.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: The unbelievers said to their Messengers, 'We will assuredly expel you from our land, or you will surely return into our creed.' Then did their Lord reveal unto them: 'We will surely destroy the evildoers,

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And those who disbelieved, said to their Messengers: "Surely, we shall drive you out of our land, or you shall return to our religion." So their Lord inspired them: "Truly, We shall destroy the Zalimun (polytheists, disbelievers and wrong-doers.).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Those who disbelieved said to their messengers, “We will expel you from our land, unless you return to our religion.” And their Lord inspired them: “We will destroy the wrongdoers.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then the unbelievers told their Messengers: "You will have to return to the fold of our faith or else we shall banish you from our land." Thereupon their Lord revealed to them: "We will most certainly destroy these wrong-doers,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And those who disbelieved, said to their Messengers: "Surely, we shall drive you out of our land, or you shall return to our religion." So their Lord revealed to them: "Truly, We shall destroy the wrongdoers."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And those who disbelieved said unto their messengers: Verily we will drive you out from our land, unless ye return to our religion. Then their Lord inspired them, (saying): Verily we shall destroy the wrong-doers,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Those who disbelieved said to their Messengers: 'Return to our faith or we will banish you from our land' But Allah revealed to them: 'We shall destroy the harmdoers

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And those who disbelieved said to their messengers, "We will surely drive you out of our land, or you must return to our religion." So their Lord inspired to them, "We will surely destroy the wrongdoers.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The disbelievers told the Messengers, "We shall expel you from our land unless you revert to our religion." Their Lord then sent them (the messengers) a revelation, "We have decided to destroy the unjust

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Those who deny the truth said to their messengers, "We shall banish you from our land unless you return to our ways." But their Lord inspired the messengers, saying, "We shall destroy the evil-doers,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And the Unbelievers said to their messengers: "Be sure we shall drive you out of our land, or ye shall return to our religion." But their Lord inspired (this Message) to them: "Verily We shall cause the wrong-doers to perish!

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And warn the people of a day when the punishment will come upon them, therefore the unjust will say, “O our Lord! Give us respite for a little while – for us to obey Your call and follow the Noble Messengers”; (It will be said) “So had you not sworn before that, ‘We have not to move to any place else from the earth’?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And warn mankind of the day when the chastisement comes on them, And those who did evil shall say, 'Our Lord, defer us to a near term, and we will answer Thy call, and follow the Messengers.' 'Ah, but did you not swear aforetime there should be no removing for you?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And warn (O Muhammad SAW) mankind of the Day when the torment will come unto them; then the wrong-doers will say: "Our Lord! Respite us for a little while, we will answer Your Call and follow the Messengers!" (It will be said): "Had you not sworn aforetime that you would not leave (the world for the Hereafter).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And warn mankind of the Day when the punishment will come upon them, and the wicked will say, “Our Lord, defer us for a little while, and we will answer Your call and follow the messengers.” Did you not swear before that there will be no passing away for you?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (O Muhammad), warn mankind of the Day when a severe chastisement shall overtake them, and the wrong-doers will say: "Our Lord, grant us respite for a short while; we shall respond to Your call and will follow Your Messengers." (But they will be clearly told): "Are you not the same who swore earlier that they shall never suffer decline?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And warn mankind of the Day when the torment will come unto them; then the wrongdoers will say: "Our Lord! Respite us for a little while, we will answer Your call and follow the Messengers!" (It will be said:) "Had you not sworn aforetime that you would not leave (the world for the Hereafter)."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And warn mankind of a day when the doom will come upon them, and those who did wrong will say: Our Lord! Reprieve us for a little while. We will obey Thy call and will follow the messengers. (It will be answered): Did ye not swear before that there would be no end for you?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Warn mankind of the Day when the punishment will overtake them, when the evildoers will say: 'Our Lord, grant us respite for awhile, we will answer Your call, and follow the Messengers' Did you not once swear that you would never cease?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And, [O Muhammad], warn the people of a Day when the punishment will come to them and those who did wrong will say, "Our Lord, delay us for a short term; we will answer Your call and follow the messengers." [But it will be said], "Had you not sworn, before, that for you there would be no cessation?

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), warn the people of the day when torment will approach them and the unjust will say, "Lord, give us respite for a little time so that we may answer your call and follow the Messengers." (The answer to their prayer will be), "Did you not swear before that you would never perish?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Warn men of the Day when the punishment will come upon them, and when the wrongdoers will say, "Our Lord, grant us respite for a short while. We will respond to Your call and will follow the messengers." [But God will answer], are you not those who swore that you would never suffer any decline?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: So warn mankind of the Day when the Wrath will reach them: then will the wrong-doers say: "Our Lord! respite us (if only) for a short term: we will answer Thy call, and follow the messengers!" "What! were ye not wont to swear aforetime that ye should suffer no decline?

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: So do not ever assume that Allah will not fulfil His promise to His Noble Messengers; indeed Allah is the Dominant, the Avenger.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So do not deem that God will fail in His promise to His Messengers; surely God is All-mighty, Vengeful.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So think not that Allah will fail to keep His Promise to His Messengers. Certainly, Allah is All-Mighty, - All-Able of Retribution.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Do not ever think that God will break His promise to His messengers. God is Strong, Able to Avenge.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: So, do not think, (O Prophet), that Allah will go back upon His promise to His Messengers. Surely Allah is Mighty, Lord of retribution.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So think not that Allah will fail to keep His promise to His Messengers. Certainly, Allah is All-Mighty, All-Able of Retribution.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: So think not that Allah will fail to keep His promise to His messengers. Lo! Allah is Mighty, Able to Requite (the wrong).

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Do not think that Allah will break the promise He gave to His Messengers. Mighty is Allah, and Vengeful.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So never think that Allah will fail in His promise to His messengers. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: You must not even think that God will disregard His promise to His messengers. God is Majestic and Revengeful.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Never think that God will fail in His promise to His messengers. God is mighty and capable of retribution.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Never think that Allah would fail his messengers in His promise: for Allah is Exalted in power, - the Lord of Retribution.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Did not the tidings of those before you reach you? The people of Nooh, and the A’ad and the Thamud, and those after them? Only Allah knows them; their Noble Messengers came to them with clear proofs, they therefore raised their hands towards their own mouths, and said, “We disbelieve in what you have been sent with, and we are in a deeply intriguing doubt regarding the path you call us to.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Has there not come to you the tidings of those who were before you -- the people of Noah, Ad, Thamood, and of those after them whom none knows but God? Their Messengers came to them with the clear signs; but they thrust their hands into their mouths, saying, 'We certainly disbelieve in the Message you have been sent with, and we are in doubt, concerning that you call us unto, disquieting.'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Has not the news reached you, of those before you, the people of Nuh (Noah), and 'Ad, and Thamud? And those after them? None knows them but Allah. To them came their Messengers with clear proofs, but they put their hands in their mouths (biting them from anger) and said: "Verily, we disbelieve in that with which you have been sent, and we are really in grave doubt as to that to which you invite us (i.e. Islamic Monotheism)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Has not the story reached you, of those before you, the people of Noah, and Aad, and Thamood—and those after them? None knows them except God. Their messengers came to them with the clear proofs, but they tried to silence them, and said, “We reject what you are sent with, and we are in serious doubt regarding what you are calling us to.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Have the accounts of your predecessors not reached you: the people of Noah, the Ad, the Thamud, and those who came after them - they whose number is not known to any except Allah? Their Messengers came to them with Clear Signs, but they thrust their hands in their mouths, and said: "We do surely reject the Message you have brought, and we are in disquieting doubt about what you are summoning us to."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Has not the news reached you, of those before you, the people of Nuh, `Ad, and Thamud And those after them None knows them but Allah. To them came their Messengers with clear proofs, but they put their hands in their mouths and said: "Verily, we disbelieve in that with which you have been sent, and we are really in grave doubt as to that to which you invite us."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Hath not the history of those before you reached you: the folk of Noah, and (the tribes of) A'ad and Thamud, and those after them? None save Allah knoweth them. Their messengers came unto them with clear proofs, but they thrust their hands into their mouths, and said: Lo! we disbelieve in that wherewith ye have been sent, and lo! we are in grave doubt concerning that to which ye call us.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Have you not heard what befell the nations that have gone before you? The nations of Noah, Aad, and Thamood, and those who came after? None knows them but Allah. Their Messengers came to them with clear signs, but they thrust their hands into their mouths and said: 'Without doubt we disbelieve the Message you have been sent with. That which you call us to is disquieting'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Has there not reached you the news of those before you - the people of Noah and 'Aad and Thamud and those after them? No one knows them but Allah. Their messengers brought them clear proofs, but they returned their hands to their mouths and said, "Indeed, we disbelieve in that with which you have been sent, and indeed we are, about that to which you invite us, in disquieting doubt."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Have you (believers) ever heard the news about those who lived before you, like the people of Noah, Ad, Thamud, and those who lived after them? No one knows about them except God. Messengers were sent to them with miracles, but they put their hands to their mouths and said, "We do not believe in whatever you preach and we are also doubtful and uncertain about that to which you invite us."

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Has not news come to you concerning those who preceded you, such as Noah's people, and the 'Ad and Thamud, as well as those who came after them? Only God knows who they were. The messengers came to them with clear signs, but they put their hands to their mouths saying, "We deny the message you have been sent with. We have grave doubts about what you are inviting us to do."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Has not the story reached you, (O people!), of those who (went) before you? - of the people of Noah, and 'Ad, and Thamud? - And of those who (came) after them? None knows them but Allah. To them came messengers with Clear (Signs); but they put their hands up to their mouths, and said: "We do deny (the mission) on which ye have been sent, and we are really in suspicious (disquieting) doubt as to that to which ye invite us."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And never does a Noble Messenger come to them, but they mock at him.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and not a single Messenger came to them, but they mocked at him;

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And never came a Messenger to them but they did mock him.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: But no messenger came to them, but they ridiculed him.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And whenever a Messenger came to them, they never failed to mock him.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And there never came a Messenger to them but that they mocked him.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And never came there unto them a messenger but they did mock him.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: But no Messenger came to them except he was mocked.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And no messenger would come to them except that they ridiculed him.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: No Messenger went to them whom they did not mock.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: but there was never a messenger who came to them but they mocked him:

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: But never came a messenger to them but they mocked him.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And indeed a Noble Messenger came to them from among them – in response they denied him, and therefore the punishment seized them, and they were unjust.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: There came indeed to them a Messenger from amongst them, but they cried him lies; so they were seized by the chastisement while they were evildoers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And verily, there had come unto them a Messenger (Muhammad SAW) from among themselves, but they denied him, so the torment overtook them while they were Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers, etc.).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: A messenger from among them had come to them, but they denounced him, so the punishment seized them in the midst of their wrongdoing.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Most certainly a Messenger came to them from among them; but they rejected him, calling him a liar. Therefore chastisement seized them while they engaged in wrong-doing.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: There has come to them a Messenger from among themselves, but they denied him, so the torment seized them while they were wrongdoers.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And verily there had come unto them a messenger from among them, but they had denied him, and so the torment seized them while they were wrong-doers.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: A Messenger from their own was sent to them, but they belied him. So while they were harmdoers they were seized by the punishment.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And there had certainly come to them a Messenger from among themselves, but they denied him; so punishment overtook them while they were wrongdoers.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: A Messenger from their own people came to them and they called him a liar. Torment struck them because of their injustice.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: There came to them a messenger from among themselves, but they rejected him as false, so punishment overtook them, as they were wrongdoers.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And there came to them a Messenger from among themselves, but they falsely rejected him; so the Wrath seized them even in the midst of their iniquities.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And the polytheists said, “Had Allah willed, we would not have worshipped anything besides Him – neither we nor our forefathers – and nor would we have forbidden anything, whilst being disassociated with Him”; those before them did exactly this; so what is (incumbent) upon the Noble Messengers, except to plainly convey (the message)?

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: The idolators say, 'If God had willed we would not have served; apart from Him, anything, neither we nor our fathers, nor would we have forbidden, apart from Him, anything.' So did those before them; yet is aught for the Messengers, but to deliver the manifest Message?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And those who join others in worship with Allah say: "If Allah had so willed, neither we nor our fathers would have worshipped aught but Him, nor would we have forbidden anything without (Command from) Him." So did those before them. Then! Are the Messengers charged with anything but to convey clearly the Message?

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: The idolaters say, “Had God willed, we would not have worshiped anything besides Him, neither us, nor our ancestors, nor would we have prohibited anything besides His prohibitions.” Those before them did likewise. Are the messengers responsible for anything but clear communication?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Those who associate others with Allah in His Divinity say: "Were Allah to will so, neither we nor our forefathers would have worshipped any other than Him, nor would we have prohibited anything without His command." Their predecessors proffered similar excuses. Do the Messengers have any other duty but to plainly convey the Message?

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And those who worshipped others with Allah said: "If Allah had so willed, neither we nor our fathers would have worshipped any but Him nor would we have forbidden anything without (a command from) Him." Those before them did the same. Then! Are the Messengers charged with anything but to clearly convey the Message

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And the idolaters say: Had Allah willed, we had not worshipped aught beside Him, we and our fathers, nor had we forbidden aught without (command from) Him. Even so did those before them. Are the messengers charged with aught save plain conveyance (of the message)?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: The idolaters say: 'Had Allah willed, neither we nor our fathers would have worshipped anything other than Him, nor would we have forbidden anything without Him', as such did those before them. Yet what should Messengers do but give a clear deliverance?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And those who associate others with Allah say, "If Allah had willed, we would not have worshipped anything other than Him, neither we nor our fathers, nor would we have forbidden anything through other than Him." Thus did those do before them. So is there upon the messengers except [the duty of] clear notification?

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The pagans had said, "Had God wanted we would not have worshipped anything other than Him, nor would our fathers. We would not have forbidden anything without (a command from) Him." The same thing was said by the people who lived before them. Are the Messengers expected to do more than just preach?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Those who associate [others with God] say, "If God had so willed we would not have worshipped anything besides Him, neither we nor our fathers, nor would we have forbidden anything without His sanction." So did those who went before them. The duty of the messengers is only to convey the message clearly.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: The worshippers of false gods say: "If Allah had so willed, we should not have worshipped aught but Him - neither we nor our fathers,- nor should we have prescribed prohibitions other than His." So did those who went before them. But what is the mission of messengers but to preach the Clear Message?

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And indeed We sent to every nation a Noble Messenger (proclaiming) that “Worship Allah and beware of the devil”; therefore Allah guided some of them, and error proved true upon some of them; therefore travel in the land and see what sort of fate befell the deniers!

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Indeed, We sent forth among every nation a Messenger,; saying: 'Serve you God, and eschew idols.' Then some. of them God guided, and some were justly disposed to error. So journey in the land, and behold how was the end of them that cried lies.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And verily, We have sent among every Ummah (community, nation) a Messenger (proclaiming): "Worship Allah (Alone), and avoid (or keep away from) Taghut (all false deities, etc.i. e. do not worship Taghut besides Allah)." Then of them were some whom Allah guided and of them were some upon whom the straying was justified. So travel through the land and see what was the end of those who denied (the truth).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: To every community We sent a messenger: “Worship God, and avoid idolatry.” Some of them God guided, while others deserved misguidance. So travel through the earth, and see what the fate of the deniers was.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We raised a Messenger in every community (to tell them): "Serve Allah and shun the Evil One." Thereafter Allah guided some of them while others were overtaken by error. Go about the earth, then, and observe what was the end of those who rejected the Messengers, calling them liars.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And We have indeed sent a Messenger to every Ummah (community, nation) (saying): "Worship Allah (Alone), and shun the Taghut (all false deities). " Then among them were some whom Allah guided, and among them were some who deserved to be left to stray. So travel through the land and see the end of those who denied (the truth).

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And verily We have raised in every nation a messenger, (proclaiming): Serve Allah and shun false gods. Then some of them (there were) whom Allah guided, and some of them (there were) upon whom error had just hold. Do but travel in the land and see the nature of the consequence for the deniers!

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We sent a Messenger to every nation, saying: 'Worship Allah and avoid the idols' Amongst them were some whom Allah guided, and some justly disposed to error. Travel in the land and see what was the end of those who belied (the Revelation and the prophets)!

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We certainly sent into every nation a messenger, [saying], "Worship Allah and avoid Taghut." And among them were those whom Allah guided, and among them were those upon whom error was [deservedly] decreed. So proceed through the earth and observe how was the end of the deniers.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: To every nation We sent a Messenger who told its people, "Worship God and stay away from satan." Some of them were guided by God and others were doomed to go astray. Travel through the land and see how terrible was the end for those who rejected the truth!

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We raised among every people a messenger who enjoined, "Worship God alone and shun the evil one." Then among them were some whom God guided and among them were others who became deserving of ruin. So travel across the earth and observe what was the end of those who rejected the messengers.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: For We assuredly sent amongst every People a messenger, (with the Command), "Serve Allah, and eschew Evil": of the People were some whom Allah guided, and some on whom error became inevitably (established). So travel through the earth, and see what was the end of those who denied (the Truth).

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: By Allah, We indeed sent Noble Messengers to several nations before you, but Satan made their misdeeds appear good to them – so he only is their companion this day, and for them is a punishment, most painful.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: By God, assuredly We sent Messengers to nations before thee, but Satan decked out fair to them their deeds; he is their protector today, and there yet awaits them a painful chastisement.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: By Allah, We indeed sent (Messengers) to the nations before you (O Muhammad SAW), but Shaitan (Satan) made their deeds fair-seeming to them. So he (Satan) is their Wali (helper) today (i.e. in this world), and theirs will be a painful torment.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: By God, We sent messengers to communities before you, but Satan made their deeds appear alluring to them. He is their master today, and they will have a painful punishment.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: By Allah, (O Muhammad), We sent Messengers to other communities before you but Satan made their evil deeds attractive to them (so they paid no heed to the call of the Messengers). The same Satan is their patron today and they are heading towards a painful chastisement.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: By Allah, We indeed sent (Messengers) to the nations before you, but Shaytan made their deeds seeming fair to them. So today he is their helper, and theirs will be a painful torment.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: By Allah, We verily sent messengers unto the nations before thee, but the devil made their deeds fairseeming unto them. So he is their patron this day, and theirs will be a painful doom.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Indeed, by Allah, We have sent Messengers before you to other nations. But satan made their deeds seem fair to them so that today he is their guardian, and a painful punishment awaits them.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: By Allah, We did certainly send [messengers] to nations before you, but Satan made their deeds attractive to them. And he is the disbelievers' ally today [as well], and they will have a painful punishment.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: By God, We sent (Messengers) to nations who lived before you. Satan made their deeds seem attractive to them and, on the Day of Judgment, satan will be their guardian. For them there will be a painful punishment.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: By God! We have sent messengers before you to other nations. But Satan made their [foul] deeds seem fair to them and today he is their patron. They shall have a painful punishment.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: By Allah, We (also) sent (Our messengers) to Peoples before thee; but Satan made, (to the wicked), their own acts seem alluring: He is also their patron today, but they shall have a most grievous penalty.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Or, you come to possess a house of gold; or ascend to the skies, though we shall not believe in your having ascended till you bring down a book for us which we could read." Say: "Glory to my Lord. I am only man and a messenger."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: or till thou possessest a house of gold ornament, or till thou goest up into heaven; and we will not believe thy going up till thou bringest down on us a book that we may read. Say: 'Glory be to my Lord. Am I aught but a mortal, a Messenger?'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "Or you have a house of adornable materials (like silver and pure gold, etc.), or you ascend up into the sky, and even then we will put no faith in your ascension until you bring down for us a Book that we would read." Say (O Muhammad SAW): "Glorified (and Exalted) be my Lord (Allah) above all that evil they (polytheists) associate with Him! Am I anything but a man, sent as a Messenger?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Or you possess a house of gold. Or you ascend into the sky. Even then, we will not believe in your ascension, unless you bring down for us a book that we can read.” Say, “Glory be to my Lord. Am I anything but a human messenger?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: or that there come to be for you a house of gold, or that you ascend to the sky - though we shall not believe in your ascension (to the sky) - until you bring down a book for us that we can read." Say to them, (O Muhammad): "Holy is my Lord! Am I anything else than a human being, who bears a Message (from Allah)?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "Or you have a house of Zukhruf, or you ascend up into the sky, and even then we will put no faith in your ascension until you bring down for us a Book that we would read." Say: "Glorified be my Lord! Am I anything but a man, sent as a Messenger"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Or thou have a house of gold; or thou ascend up into heaven, and even then we will put no faith in thine ascension till thou bring down for us a book that we can read. Say (O Muhammad): My Lord be Glorified! Am I aught save a mortal messenger?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: or, until you possess an ornate house of gold, or ascend into the heavens; and we will not believe in your ascension until you have brought down for us a book which we can read' Say: 'Exaltations to my Lord! Am I anything except a human Messenger'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Or you have a house of gold or you ascend into the sky. And [even then], we will not believe in your ascension until you bring down to us a book we may read." Say, "Exalted is my Lord! Was I ever but a human messenger?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: or (show us) that you have a well adorned house of your own, or climb into the sky. We shall never believe that you have climbed into the sky until you bring us a book that we can read." Say, "All glory belongs to my Lord. Am I more than a mortal Messenger?"

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: or you have a house made of gold; or you ascend to heaven; and we will not believe in your ascension until you send down to us a Book that we can read." Tell them, "Holy is my Lord. I am but a human being sent as a messenger."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: "Or thou have a house adorned with gold, or thou mount a ladder right into the skies. No, we shall not even believe in thy mounting until thou send down to us a book that we could read." Say: "Glory to my Lord! Am I aught but a man,- a messenger?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: Their requital will be Hell, because they disbelieved and mocked My signs and messengers.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: This is their reward – hell – because they disbelieved, and made a mockery of My verses and My Noble Messengers.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: That is their recompense -- Gehenna for that they were unbelievers and took My signs and My messengers in mockery.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "That shall be their recompense, Hell; because they disbelieved and took My Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) and My Messengers by way of jest and mockery.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: That is their requital—Hell—on account of their disbelief, and their taking My revelations and My messengers in mockery.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Hell is their recompense for disbelieving and their taking My revelations and My Messengers as objects of jest.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "That shall be their recompense, Hell; because they disbelieved and took My Ayat and My Messengers for jest."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: That is their reward: hell, because they disbelieved, and made a jest of Our revelations and Our messengers.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Gehenna is their recompense; because they disbelieved and mocked My verses, and My Messengers.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: That is their recompense - Hell - for what they denied and [because] they took My signs and My messengers in ridicule.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Hell will be their reward, because they denied the truth, and made a jest of My signs and My messengers.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: That is their reward, Hell, because they rejected Faith, and took My Signs and My Messengers by way of jest.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And remember Moosa in the Book; he was indeed a chosen one, and he was a Noble Messenger, a Herald of the Hidden.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And mention in the Book Moses; he was devoted, and he was a Messenger, a Prophet.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And mention in the Book (this Quran) Musa (Moses). Verily! He was chosen and he was a Messenger (and) a Prophet.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And mention in the Scripture Moses. He was dedicated. He was a messenger and a prophet.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And recite in the Book the account of Moses. He was a chosen one, a Messenger, a Prophet.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And mention in the Book, Musa. Verily, he was Mukhlasan and he was a Messenger, (and) a Prophet.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And make mention in the Scripture of Moses. Lo! he was chosen, and he was a messenger (of Allah), a prophet.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Mention in the Book, Moses. He was devoted, a Messenger, and a Prophet.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And mention in the Book, Moses. Indeed, he was chosen, and he was a messenger and a prophet.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), mention in the Book (the Quran) the story of Moses. Moses was a sincere person, a Messengers and a Prophet.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Tell also of Moses in the Book. He was indeed a chosen one, and was a messenger and a prophet.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Also mention in the Book (the story of) Moses: for he was specially chosen, and he was a messenger (and) a prophet.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And We did not send any Noble Messenger before you, but We divinely revealed to him that, “There is no God except I (Allah), therefore worship Me alone.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And We sent never a Messenger before thee except that We revealed to him, saying, 'There is no god but I; so serve Me.'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We did not send any Messenger before you (O Muhammad SAW) but We inspired him (saying): La ilaha illa Ana [none has the right to be worshipped but I (Allah)], so worship Me (Alone and none else)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We never sent a messenger before you without inspiring him that: “There is no god but I, so worship Me.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Never did We send any Messenger before you to whom We did not reveal: "There is no god but Me. So serve Me alone."

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And We did not send any Messenger before you but We revealed to him (saying): "There is no God but I, so worship Me."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We sent no messenger before thee but We inspired him, (saying): There is no Allah save Me (Allah), so worship Me.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We never sent a Messenger before you except that We revealed to him saying: 'There is no god except Me, therefore, worship Me'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We sent not before you any messenger except that We revealed to him that, "There is no deity except Me, so worship Me."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: To all the Messengers that were sent before you We revealed that I am the only God to be worshipped.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We sent all messengers before you with this revelation: "There is no deity save Me, so worship Me alone."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Not a messenger did We send before thee without this inspiration sent by Us to him: that there is no god but I; therefore worship and serve Me.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And indeed the Noble Messengers before you were mocked at, but their mockery ruined the mockers themselves.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Messengers indeed were mocked at before thee, but those that scoffed at them were encompassed by that they mocked at.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Indeed (many) Messengers were mocked before you (O Muhammad SAW), but the scoffers were surrounded by that, whereat they used to mock.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Messengers before you were also ridiculed, but those who jeered were surrounded by what they had ridiculed.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Other Messengers before you were also mocked, but those who scoffed at the Messengers were overtaken by the same scourge that they had scoffed at.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Indeed (many) Messengers were mocked before you, but the scoffers were surrounded by what they used to mock.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Messengers before thee, indeed, were mocked, but that whereat they mocked surrounded those who scoffed at them.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Before you, other Messengers were mocked, but the mockers were encompassed by the very thing they mocked.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And already were messengers ridiculed before you, but those who mocked them were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They mocked the Messengers who were sent before you; thus, the torment which they had ridiculed encompassed them all.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Other messengers have been mocked before you, but those who scoffed were overwhelmed by the very thing they had mocked.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Mocked were (many) messenger before thee; But their scoffers were hemmed in by the thing that they mocked.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And fight in Allah's cause as is the true manner of fighting; He has preferred you and has not kept any hardship upon you in religion; the religion of your father Ibrahim; Allah has named you Muslims – in the previous Books and in this Qur’an, so that the Noble Messenger be your guardian and witness, and you be witness against other people; therefore keep the prayer established and give charity, and hold fast to the rope of Allah; He is your Master; so what an excellent Master and what an excellent Supporter!

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and struggle for God as is His due, for He has chosen you, and has laid on you no impediment in your religion, being the creed of your father Abraham; He named you Muslims aforetime and in this, that the Messenger might be a witness against you, and that you might be witnesses against mankind. So perform the prayer, and pay the alms, and hold you fast to God; He is your Protector -- an excellent Protector, an excellent Helper.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And strive hard in Allah's Cause as you ought to strive (with sincerity and with all your efforts that His Name should be superior). He has chosen you (to convey His Message of Islamic Monotheism to mankind by inviting them to His religion, Islam), and has not laid upon you in religion any hardship, it is the religion of your father Ibrahim (Abraham) (Islamic Monotheism). It is He (Allah) Who has named you Muslims both before and in this (the Quran), that the Messenger (Muhammad SAW) may be a witness over you and you be witnesses over mankind! So perform As-Salat (Iqamat-as-Salat), give Zakat and hold fast to Allah [i.e. have confidence in Allah, and depend upon Him in all your affairs] He is your Maula (Patron, Lord, etc.), what an Excellent Maula (Patron, Lord, etc.) and what an Excellent Helper!

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And strive for God, with the striving due to Him. He has chosen you, and has not burdened you in religion—the faith of your father Abraham. It is he who named you Muslims before, and in this. So that the Messenger may be a witness over you, and you may be witnesses over the people. So pray regularly, and give regular charity, and cleave to God. He is your Protector. What an excellent Protector, and what an excellent Helper.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Strive in the cause of Allah in a manner worthy of that striving. He has chosen you (for His task), and He has not laid upon you any hardship in religion. Keep to the faith of your father Abraham. Allah named you Muslims earlier and even in this (Book), that the Messenger may be a witness over you, and that you may be witnesses over all mankind. So establish Prayer, and pay Zakah, and hold fast to Allah. He is your Protector. What an excellent Protector; what an excellent Helper!

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And strive hard in Allah's cause as you ought to strive. He has chosen you, and has not laid upon you in religion any hardship: it is the religion of your father Ibrahim. He has named you Muslims both before and in this (Qur'an), that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you be witnesses over mankind! So, perform the Salah, give the Zakah and hold fast to Allah. He is your Mawla, what an Excellent Mawla and what an Excellent Helper!

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And strive for Allah with the endeavour which is His right. He hath chosen you and hath not laid upon you in religion any hardship; the faith of your father Abraham (is yours). He hath named you Muslims of old time and in this (Scripture), that the messenger may be a witness against you, and that ye may be witnesses against mankind. So establish worship, pay the poor-due, and hold fast to Allah. He is your Protecting friend. A blessed Patron and a blessed Helper!

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Struggle for Allah as is due to Him. He has chosen you and has not laden a burden upon you in your religion, being the Creed of Abraham your father. He has named you Muslims before and in this so that the Messenger (Muhammad) can be a witness for you, and in order that you be witnesses against mankind. Therefore, establish the prayer and pay the obligatory charity and hold fast to Allah. He is your Guardian, the Excellent Guardian, the Excellent Helper!

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And strive for Allah with the striving due to Him. He has chosen you and has not placed upon you in the religion any difficulty. [It is] the religion of your father, Abraham. Allah named you "Muslims" before [in former scriptures] and in this [revelation] that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you may be witnesses over the people. So establish prayer and give zakah and hold fast to Allah. He is your protector; and excellent is the protector, and excellent is the helper.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Strive steadfastly for the Cause of God. He has chosen you but has not imposed on you hardship in your religion, the noble religion of your father, Abraham. God named you Muslims before and in this Book, so that the Messenger will witness (your actions) and will be the witness over mankind. Be steadfast in your prayer, pay the religious tax, and seek protection from God; He is your Guardian, a gracious Guardian and Helper.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Strive for the cause of God as it behoves you to strive for it. He has chosen you and laid on you no burden in the matter of your religion, the faith of Abraham your forefather. In this, as in former scriptures He has given you the name of Muslims, so that the Messenger may be a witness over you, and so that you may be witnesses over mankind. Therefore, say your prayers regularly and pay the zakat and hold fast to God. He is your master. An excellent master and an excellent helper!

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And strive in His cause as ye ought to strive, (with sincerity and under discipline). He has chosen you, and has imposed no difficulties on you in religion; it is the cult of your father Abraham. It is He Who has named you Muslims, both before and in this (Revelation); that the Messenger may be a witness for you, and ye be witnesses for mankind! So establish regular Prayer, give regular Charity, and hold fast to Allah! He is your Protector - the Best to protect and the Best to help!

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: So We sent among them a Noble Messenger from among them (saying), “Worship Allah, you do not have any other God except Him; so do you not fear?”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: and We sent amongst them a Messenger of themselves, saying, 'Serve God! You have no god other than He. Will you not be godfearing?'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We sent to them a Messenger from among themselves (saying): "Worship Allah! You have no other Ilah (God) but Him. Will you not then be afraid (of Him i.e. of His Punishment because of worshipping others besides Him)?"

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We sent among them a messenger from themselves: “Serve God. You have no god other than Him. Will you not be cautious?”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: and We sent among them a Messenger from among themselves, saying: "Serve Allah; you have no god other than He. Do you have no fear?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And We sent to them a Messenger from among themselves (saying): "Worship Allah! You have no other God but Him. Will you not then have Taqwa"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And we sent among them a messenger of their own, saying: Serve Allah, Ye have no other Allah save Him. Will ye not ward off (evil)?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: and We sent to them a Messenger from themselves, saying: 'Worship Allah, for you have no god except He. Will you not be cautious'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We sent among them a messenger from themselves, [saying], "Worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him; then will you not fear Him?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent to them a Messenger from among their own people who told them, "Worship God; He is your only Lord. Will you then not have fear of Him?"

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: and sent a messenger to them from among themselves: "Worship God alone. You have no deity other than Him. Will you not then fear God?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And We sent to them a messenger from among themselves, (saying), "Worship Allah! ye have no other god but Him. Will ye not fear (Him)?"

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: We then sent our Noble Messengers, one after another; whenever a nation’s Noble Messenger came to it they denied him, We therefore united the succeeding with the old, and made them history; so far removed be the people who do not believe!

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Then sent We Our Messengers successively; whenever its Messenger came to a nation they cried him lies, so We caused some of them to follow others, and We made them as but tales; so away with a people who do not believe!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then We sent Our Messengers in succession, every time there came to a nation their Messenger, they denied him, so We made them follow one another (to destruction), and We made them as Ahadith (the true stories for mankind to learn a lesson from them). So away with a people who believe not.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Then We sent Our messengers in succession. Every time a messenger came to his community, they called him a liar. So We made them follow one another, and made them history. So away with a people who do not believe.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then We sent Our Messengers in succession. Whenever a Messenger came to his people they rejected him, calling him a liar. Thereupon, We made each people to follow the other (to its doom), reducing them to mere tales (of the past). Scourged be the people who do not believe!

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then We sent Our Messengers in succession. Every time there came to a nation their Messenger, they denied him; so, We made them follow one another, and We made them as Ahadith. So, away with a people who believe not!

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then We sent our messengers one after another. Whenever its messenger came unto a nation they denied him; so We caused them to follow one another (to disaster) and We made them bywords. A far removal for folk who believe not!

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Then We sent Our Messengers in succession. Yet whenever its Messenger came to a nation they belied him, so We made them follow others, and We made them but as tales, so begone the nation who did not believe!

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then We sent Our messengers in succession. Every time there came to a nation its messenger, they denied him, so We made them follow one another [to destruction], and We made them narrations. So away with a people who do not believe.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent Our messengers one after the other but whenever a Messenger would come to a nation, its people would call him a liar and We would destroy one nation after the other, thus, only their stories were left behind them. God keeps the unbelievers far away from His Mercy.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: then We sent Our messengers in succession. Every time their messenger came to a people, they rejected him. So We destroyed them one after the other, and let them become mere tales. So away with the people who will not believe!

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then sent We our messengers in succession: every time there came to a people their messenger, they accused him of falsehood: so We made them follow each other (in punishment): We made them as a tale (that is told): So away with a people that will not believe!

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “O Noble Messengers, eat good clean things, and do good deeds; I know all that you do.”

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: 'O Messengers, eat of the good things and do righteousness; surely I know the things you do.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: O (you) Messengers! Eat of the Taiyibat [all kinds of Halal (legal) foods which Allah has made legal (meat of slaughtered eatable animals, milk products, fats, vegetables, fruits, etc.], and do righteous deeds. Verily! I am Well-Acquainted with what you do.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: O messengers, eat of the good things, and act with integrity. I am aware of what you do.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Messengers! Partake of the things that are clean, and act righteously. I know well all that you do.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: O Messengers! Eat of the Tayyibat and do righteous deeds. Verily, I am Well-Acquainted with what you do.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: O ye messengers! Eat of the good things, and do right. Lo! I am Aware of what ye do.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Messengers! Eat of that which is good and do good deeds; I have knowledge of the things you do.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Allah said], "O messengers, eat from the good foods and work righteousness. Indeed, I, of what you do, am Knowing.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: I told them, "Messengers, eat from the pure things and act righteously; I know all that you do.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Messengers, eat what is wholesome and do good deeds: I am well aware of what you do.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: O ye messengers! enjoy (all) things good and pure, and work righteousness: for I am well-acquainted with (all) that ye do.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Or is it that they did not recognise their Noble Messenger, therefore they consider him alien?

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Or did they not recognise their Messenger and so denied him?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Or is it that they did not recognize their Messenger (Muhammad SAW) so they deny him?

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Or is it that they did not recognize their messenger, so they are denying him?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Or is it that they were unaware of their Messenger and were therefore repelled by him for he was a stranger to them?

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Or is it that they did not recognize their Messenger so they deny him

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Or know they not their messenger, and so reject him?

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Or, is it because they do not recognize their Messenger that they denied him?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Or did they not know their Messenger, so they are toward him disacknowledging?

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Or did you not recognize your Messenger and, thus, denied him (Muhammad)

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Or do they not recognize their Messenger, and so deny him?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Or do they not recognise their Messenger, that they deny him?

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And they say, “We have accepted faith in Allah and His Noble Messenger, and we obey”; then after that a group among them turns away; and they are not Muslims.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: They say, 'We believe in God and the Messenger, and we obey.' Then after that a party of them turn away; those -- they are not believers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: They (hypocrites) say: "We have believed in Allah and in the Messenger (Muhammad SAW), and we obey," then a party of them turn away thereafter, such are not believers.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And they say, “We have believed in God and the Messenger, and we obey,” but some of them turn away afterwards. These are not believers.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: These people say "We have believed in Allah and the Messenger and we have submitted"; but soon after this, some of them turn away (from obedience): such people are not true Believers.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: They say: "We have believed in Allah and in the Messenger, and we obey," then a party of them turn away thereafter, such are not believers.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And they say: We believe in Allah and the messenger, and we obey; then after that a faction of them turn away. Such are not believers.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They say: 'We believe in Allah and the Messenger and obey' But a party of them turn away after this. Those are not believers.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: But the hypocrites say, "We have believed in Allah and in the Messenger, and we obey"; then a party of them turns away after that. And those are not believers.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They say, "We have believed in God and the Messenger and we have obeyed them." Then a group of them turn away from their (belief). They are not believers.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: They say, "We believe in God and in the Messenger, and we obey." But then, even after that a group of them will turn away. Those are surely not believers

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: They say, "We believe in Allah and in the messenger, and we obey": but even after that, some of them turn away: they are not (really) Believers.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And when called towards Allah and His Noble Messenger in order that the Noble Messenger may judge between them, thereupon a group among them turns away.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: When they are called to God and His Messenger that he may judge between them, lo, a party of them are swerving aside;

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And when they are called to Allah (i.e. His Words, the Quran) and His Messenger (SAW), to judge between them, lo! a party of them refuse (to come) and turn away.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And when they are called to God and His Messenger, in order to judge between them, some of them refuse.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: When they are called to Allah and His Messenger so that the Messenger may judge between them, a party of them turns away.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And when they are called to Allah and His Messenger, to judge between them, lo! a party of them refuses and turns away.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when they appeal unto Allah and His messenger to judge between them, lo! a faction of them are averse;

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And when they are called to Allah and His Messenger so that he judges between them, a party of them swerve away.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And when they are called to [the words of] Allah and His Messenger to judge between them, at once a party of them turns aside [in refusal].

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When they are called to God and His Messenger so that they will judge among them, suddenly, some of them turn away.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: and when they are called to God and His Messenger so that he may judge between them, some of them turn away.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: When they are summoned to Allah and His messenger, in order that He may judge between them, behold some of them decline (to come).

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Are their hearts diseased, or do they have doubts, or do they fear that Allah and His Noble Messenger will oppress them? In fact they themselves are the unjust.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: What, is there sickness in their hearts, or are they in doubt, or do they fear that God may be unjust towards them and His Messenger? Nay, but those -- they are the evildoers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Is there a disease in their hearts? Or do they doubt or fear lest Allah and His Messenger (SAW) should wrong them in judgement. Nay, it is they themselves who are the Zalimun (polytheists, hypocrites and wrong-doers, etc.).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Is there sickness in their hearts? Or are they suspicious? Or do they fear that God may do them injustice? Or His Messenger? In fact, they themselves are the unjust.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Are their hearts afflicted with the disease (of hypocrisy)? Or, are they in doubt? Or, do they fear that Allah and His Messenger will be unjust to them? In fact, they themselves are unjust.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Is there a disease in their hearts Or do they doubt or fear lest Allah and His Messenger should wrong them in judgement. Nay, it is they themselves who are the wrongdoers.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Is there in their hearts a disease, or have they doubts, or fear they lest Allah and His messenger should wrong them in judgment? Nay, but such are evil-doers.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Is there a sickness in their hearts, or, are they in doubt? Do they fear that Allah and His Messenger will be unjust? No, but those they are the harmdoers.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Is there disease in their hearts? Or have they doubted? Or do they fear that Allah will be unjust to them, or His Messenger? Rather, it is they who are the wrongdoers.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Are their hearts sick? Do they have doubts or are they afraid that God and His Messenger may do injustice to them? In fact, they, themselves, are unjust.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Is there a sickness in their hearts, or are they full of doubt? Or do they fear that God and His Messenger will be unjust to them? The truth is that they themselves are wrongdoers.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Is it that there is a disease in their hearts? or do they doubt, or are they in fear, that Allah and His Messenger will deal unjustly with them? Nay, it is they themselves who do wrong.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: The saying of the Muslims when they are called towards Allah and His Noble Messenger in order that the Noble Messenger judge between them is that they submit, “We hear and we obey”; and it is they who have attained the goal.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: All that the believers say, when they are called to God and His Messenger, that he may judge between them, is that they say, 'We hear, and we obey'; those -- they are the prosperers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: The only saying of the faithful believers, when they are called to Allah (His Words, the Quran) and His Messenger (SAW), to judge between them, is that they say: "We hear and we obey." And such are the prosperous ones (who will live forever in Paradise).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: The response of the believers, when they are called to God and His Messenger in order to judge between them, is to say, “We hear and we obey.” These are the successful.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: As regards the Believers, when they are called towards Allah and His Messenger so that the Messenger may judge between them, they say, "We have heard and obeyed"; such are the people who attain true success,

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: The only saying of the faithful believers, when they are called to Allah and His Messenger, to judge between them, is that they say: "We hear and we obey." And such are the successful.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: The saying of (all true) believers when they appeal unto Allah and His messenger to judge between them is only that they say: We hear and we obey. And such are the successful.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: But when the believers are called to Allah and His Messenger, in order that he judges between them, their reply is: 'We hear and obey' Such are theprosperous.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: The only statement of the [true] believers when they are called to Allah and His Messenger to judge between them is that they say, "We hear and we obey." And those are the successful.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When the believers are called to God and His Messenger to be judged, their only words are, "We have listened and obeyed." They will have everlasting happiness.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: The response of the believers, when they are called to God and His Messenger in order that he may judge between them, is only, "We hear and we obey." It is they who will prosper:

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: The answer of the Believers, when summoned to Allah and His Messenger, in order that He may judge between them, is no other than this: they say, "We hear and we obey": it is such as these that will attain felicity.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And whoever obeys the command of Allah and His Noble Messenger, and fears Allah, and practices piety – so it is they who are the successful.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Whoso obeys God and His Messenger, and fears God and has awe of Him, those -- they are the triumphant.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And whosoever obeys Allah and His Messenger (SAW), fears Allah, and keeps his duty (to Him), such are the successful ones.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Whoever obeys God and His Messenger, and fears God, and is conscious of Him—these are the winners.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: and only those attain true success who obey Allah and His Messenger and fear Allah and refrain from His disobedience.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And whosoever obeys Allah and His Messenger, fears Allah, and has Taqwa of Him, such are the successful.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He who obeyeth Allah and His messenger, and feareth Allah, and keepeth duty (unto Him): such indeed are the victorious.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Those who obey Allah and His Messenger, and fear Allah, and have awe of Him, shall be the winners.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger and fears Allah and is conscious of Him - it is those who are the attainers.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Those who obey God and His Messenger, who are humble before Him, and who have fear of Him will, certainly, be successful.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: those who obey God and His Messenger, and fear God, and are mindful of their duty to Him, are the ones who will triumph.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: It is such as obey Allah and His Messenger, and fear Allah and do right, that will win (in the end),

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And keep the prayer established and pay the obligatory charity and obey the Noble Messenger, in the hope of attaining mercy.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Perform the prayer, and pay the alms, and obey the Messenger -- haply so you will find mercy.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And perform As-Salat (Iqamat-as-Salat), and give Zakat and obey the Messenger (Muhammad SAW) that you may receive mercy (from Allah).

translation.author: Itani
