translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Nay! he has come with the truth and he confirms the Messengers.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: No, indeed, he has brought the truth, and confirmed the Messengers.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Rather, the Prophet has come with the truth and confirmed the [previous] messengers.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: In fact, he had brought them the truth and had acknowledged the Messengers (who were sent before him).

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Nay! he has come with the (very) Truth, and he confirms (the Message of) the messengers (before him).

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: Allah has indeed made the truthful dream of His Noble Messenger, come true; indeed you will all enter the Sacred Mosque, if Allah wills, in safety – with your heads shaven or hair cut short – without fear; so He knows what you do not know, and has therefore ordained another imminent victory before this.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: God has indeed fulfilled the vision He vouchsafed to His Messenger truly: 'You shall enter the Holy Mosque, if God wills, in security, your heads shaved, your hair cut short, not fearing.' He knew what you knew not, and appointed ere that a nigh victory.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Indeed Allah shall fulfil the true vision which He showed to His Messenger (SAW) [i.e. the Prophet SAW saw a dream that he has entered Makkah along with his companions, having their (head) hair shaved and cut short] in very truth. Certainly, you shall enter Al-Masjid-al-Haram; if Allah wills, secure, (some) having your heads shaved, and (some) having your head hair cut short, having no fear. He knew what you knew not, and He granted besides that a near victory.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Allah indeed showed His Messenger the true vision, one fully in accord with reality. If Allah so wills you shall certainly enter the Inviolable Mosque, in full security, you will shave your heads and cut your hair short, and do so without any fear. He knew what you did not know, and He granted you a victory near at hand even before (the fulfilment of the vision).

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Indeed Allah shall fulfill the true vision which He showed to His Messenger in very truth. Certainly, you shall enter Al-Masjid Al-Haram, if Allah wills, secure, (some) having your heads shaved, and (some) having your hair cut short, having no fear. He knew what you knew not, and He granted besides that a near victory.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Allah hath fulfilled the vision for His messenger in very truth. Ye shall indeed enter the Inviolable Place of Worship, if Allah will, secure, (having your hair) shaven and cut, not fearing. But He knoweth that which ye know not, and hath given you a near victory beforehand.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Certainly has Allah showed to His Messenger the vision in truth. You will surely enter al-Masjid al-Haram, if Allah wills, in safety, with your heads shaved and [hair] shortened, not fearing [anyone]. He knew what you did not know and has arranged before that a conquest near [at hand].

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: God made the dream of His Messenger come true for a genuine purpose. (In this he was told), "If God wills You (believers) will enter the Sacred Mosque, in security, with your heads shaved, nails cut, and without any fear in your hearts." He knew what you did not know. Besides this victory, He will give you another immediate victory.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: God has in all truth shown His Messenger a true vision in which He said, "God willing, you will most certainly enter the Sacred Mosque in safety and without fear, shaven-headed or with hair cut short" -- God knew what you did not; and has given you a victory beforehand.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Truly did Allah fulfil the vision for His Messenger: ye shall enter the Sacred Mosque, if Allah wills, with minds secure, heads shaved, hair cut short, and without fear. For He knew what ye knew not, and He granted, besides this, a speedy victory.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He has power over His creatures, and appoints guardians to watch over them. When death comes to one of you, Our messengers take away his soul, and do not falter.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: He is the Omnipotent over His servants. He sends recorders over you till, when any one of you is visited by death, Our messengers take him and they neglect not.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: And He is the supreme over His creatures, and He sendeth guardians over you until when death cometh unto one of you Our messengers take his soul, and they fail not.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: He is the Irresistible, Supreme over His slaves, and He sends guardians (angels guarding and writing all of one's good and bad deeds) over you, until when death approaches one of you, Our Messengers (angel of death and his assistants) take his soul, and they never neglect their duty.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He is the Qahir over His servants, and He sends guardians over you, until when death approaches one of you, Our messengers take his soul, and they never neglect their duty.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He is the Omnipotent over His slaves. He sendeth guardians over you until, when death cometh unto one of you, Our messengers receive him, and they neglect not.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He is the All-dominant over His servants, and He sends guards to [protect] you. When death approaches anyone of you, Our messengers take him away and they do not neglect [their duty].

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He is the Conqueror over His worshipers. He sends forth guardians who watch over you until death comes to one of you, when Our messengers take him, and they are not neglectful.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And He is the subjugator over His servants, and He sends over you guardian-angels until, when death comes to one of you, Our messengers take him, and they do not fail [in their duties].

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: He is Dominant over all His creatures and He sends guards to watch over you until death approaches you. Then His angelic Messengers will, without fail, take away your souls.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: So undoubtedly We shall question those to whom Our Noble Messengers went, and indeed We shall question the Noble Messengers.

translation.author: Daryabadi
translation.text: Then We will surely question those to whom were the messengers sent, and We will surely question the sent ones.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then surely, We shall question those (people) to whom it (the Book) was sent and verily, We shall question the Messengers.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We will question those to whom messengers were sent, and We will question the messengers.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: So We shall call to account those to whom Messengers were sent, and We shall call to account the Messengers (to see how dutifully they conveyed the Message, and how people responded to it).

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then surely, We shall question those (people) to whom it was sent and verily, We shall question the Messengers.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then verily We shall question those unto whom (Our message) hath been sent, and verily We shall question the messengers.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We will question those to whom Our Message was sent, as We shall question the Messengers.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Then We will surely question those to whom [a message] was sent, and We will surely question the messengers.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We will certainly question the people and the Messengers sent to them.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: So they hamstrung the she-camel and rebelled against the command of their Lord and said, “O Saleh! Bring upon us what you promise us, if you are a Noble Messenger.”

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: So they killed the she-camel and insolently defied the Commandment of their Lord, and said: "O Salih (Saleh)! Bring about your threats if you are indeed one of the Messengers (of Allah)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: So they hamstrung the she-camel, and defied the command of their Lord, and said, “O Saleh, bring upon us what you threaten us with, if you are one of the messengers.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Then they hamstrung the she-camel, disdainfuliy disobeyed the commandment of their Lord, and said: 'O Salih! Bring upon us the scourge with which you threatened us if you are truly a Messenger [of Allah].'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: So they killed the she-camel and insolently defied the commandment of their Lord, and said: "O Salih! Bring about your threats if you are indeed one of the Messengers (of Allah)."

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: (Then) they hamstrung the shecamel and defied the order of their Lord, saying to Salih: 'Bring down that which you have promised us if you truly are one of the Messengers'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So they hamstrung the she-camel and were insolent toward the command of their Lord and said, "O Salih, bring us what you promise us, if you should be of the messengers."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They then slew the camel and rebelled against the orders of their Lord saying, " Salih, if you are truly a Messenger, let that torment with which you have threatened us come to pass."

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: So they hamstrung the she-camel, and insolently defied the commandment of their Lord, saying, "O Salih! Bring upon us what you threaten us with if you are indeed a messenger."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Then they ham-strung the she-camel, and insolently defied the order of their Lord, saying: "O Salih! bring about thy threats, if thou art a messenger (of Allah)!"

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And some villagers are those who believe in Allah and the Last Day, and consider the spending as the means of obtaining proximity to Allah and obtaining the prayers of the Noble Messenger; pay heed! Yes indeed it is the means of proximity for them; Allah will soon admit them into His mercy; indeed Allah is Oft Forgiving, Most Merciful.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: And some of the Bedouins believe in God and the Last Day, and take what they expend for offerings bringing them near to God, and the prayers of the Messenger. Surely they are an offering for them, and God will admit them into His mercy; God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Yet among the Desert-Arabs are those who believe in God and the Last Day, and consider their contribution to be a means towards God, and the prayers of the Messenger. Surely it will draw them closer, and God will admit them into His mercy. God is Forgiving and Compassionate.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And among the bedouin Arabs are those who believe in Allah and the Last Day, and regard their spending (in the Way of Allah) as a means of drawing near to Allah and of deserving the prayers of the Messenger. Indeed, this shall be a means of drawing near to Allah. Allah will surely admit them to His mercy. Allah is All-Forgiving, Ever Merciful.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And of the wandering Arabs there is he who believeth in Allah and the Last Day, and taketh that which he expendeth and also the prayers of the messenger as acceptable offerings in the sight of Allah. Lo! verily it is an acceptable offering for them. Allah will bring them into His mercy. Lo! Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Yet there are some Arabs (Juhaina and Muszaina tribes) who believe in Allah and the Last Day, and regard what they spend as a means of bringing them close to Allah and to the prayers of the Messenger. Indeed, they are an offering for them; Allah will admit them to His Mercy. He is Forgiving, Merciful.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: But among the bedouins are some who believe in Allah and the Last Day and consider what they spend as means of nearness to Allah and of [obtaining] invocations of the Messenger. Unquestionably, it is a means of nearness for them. Allah will admit them to His mercy. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Some of the desert dwelling Arabs believe in God and the Day of Judgment. Whatever they spend for the cause of God they consider it as a means of getting nearer to God and have the prayers of the Messenger in their favor. This, certainly is a means to get nearer to God. God will admit them into His mercy. God is All-forgiving and All-merciful.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: There are also those among them who believe in God and the Last Day and regard what they spend for the cause of God as a means of bringing them nearer to God and of deserving the prayers of the Messenger. This shall certainly be for them a means of drawing near to God. God will admit them into His mercy; God is indeed most forgiving and merciful.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: But some of the desert Arabs believe in Allah and the Last Day, and look on their payments as pious gifts bringing them nearer to Allah and obtaining the prayers of the Messenger. Aye, indeed they bring them nearer (to Him): soon will Allah admit them to His Mercy: for Allah is Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And when Our Clear Verses are recited unto them, those who hope not for their meeting with Us, say: Bring us a Quran other than this, or change it."Say (O Muhammad SAW): "It is not for me to change it on my own accord; I only follow that which is revealed unto me. Verily, I fear if I were to disobey my Lord, the torment of the Great Day (i.e. the Day of Resurrection)."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And when Our clear revelations are recited to them, those who do not hope to meet Us say, “Bring a Quran other than this, or change it.” Say, “It is not for me to change it of my own accord. I only follow what is revealed to me. I fear, if I disobeyed my Lord, the torment of a terrible Day.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And whenever Our clear revelations are recited to them, those who do not expect to meet Us say: 'Bring us a Qur'an other than this one, or at least make changes in it. Tell them (O Muhammad): 'It is not for me to change it of my accord. I only follow what is revealed to me. Were I to disobey my Lord, I fear the chastisement of an Awesome Day.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when Our clear revelations are recited unto them, they who look not for the meeting with Us say: Bring a Lecture other than this, or change it. Say (O Muhammad): It is not for me to change it of my accord. I only follow that which is inspired in me. Lo! if I disobey my Lord I fear the retribution of an awful Day.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When Our manifest signs are recited to them, those who do not expect to encounter Us say, ‘Bring a Quran other than this, or alter it.’ Say, ‘I may not alter it of my own accord. I follow only what is revealed to me. Indeed should I disobey my Lord, I fear the punishment of a tremendous day.’

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, "Bring us a Qur'an other than this or change it." Say, [O Muhammad], "It is not for me to change it on my own accord. I only follow what is revealed to me. Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Whenever Our authoritative revelations are recited to those who do not wish to meet Us in the life hereafter, say, "Bring us another book besides this one or change it." (Muhammad), tell them, "I can not change it myself. I only follow what is revealed to me. I fear that for disobeying my Lord I shall be punished on the great (Day of Judgment).

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when Our clear communications are recited to them, those who hope not for Our meeting say: Bring a Quran other than this or change it. Say: It does not beseem me that I should change it of myself; I follow naught but what is revealed to me; surely I fear, if I disobey my Lord, the punishment of a mighty day.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When Our clear revelations are recited to them, those who do not expect to meet Us say, "Bring us a different Quran, or make some changes in it." Say, "It is not for me to change it of my own accord. I follow only what is revealed to me. I fear, if I were to disobey my Lord, the punishment on a Dreadful Day."

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: When We let the people taste mercy after hardship has visited them, lo, they have a device concerning Our signs. Say: 'God is swifter at devising; surely Our messengers are writing down what you are devising.'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And when We let mankind taste of mercy after some adversity has afflicted them, behold! They take to plotting against Our Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.)! Say: "Allah is more Swift in planning!" Certainly, Our Messengers (angels) record all of that which you plot.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And when We let mankind taste mercy after some adversity has afflicted them, behold! They take to plotting against Our Ayat! Say: "Allah is more swift in planning!" Certainly, Our messengers (angels) record all of that which you plot.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when We cause mankind to taste of mercy after some adversity which had afflicted them, behold! they have some plot against Our revelations. Say: Allah is more swift in plotting. Lo! Our messengers write down that which ye plot.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When We let people taste [Our] mercy after a distress that has befallen them, behold, they scheme against Our signs! Say, ‘Allah is more swift at devising.’ Indeed Our messengers write down what you scheme.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: When We let people taste (Our) mercy after they had been afflicted by hardship, they devise against Our verses. Say: 'Allah is more swift in devising' Indeed, Our Messengers (the angels) are writing down whatever you devise.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And when We give the people a taste of mercy after adversity has touched them, at once they conspire against Our verses. Say, "Allah is swifter in strategy." Indeed, Our messengers record that which you conspire

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When people are granted mercy after having suffered hardship, they begin to plot against Our revelations. Say, "God is the most swift in His plans." Our angelic messengers record all that you plot.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: When We make mankind taste of some mercy after adversity hath touched them, behold! they take to plotting against Our Signs! Say: "Swifter to plan is Allah!" Verily, Our messengers record all the plots that ye make!

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And all the Noble Messengers We sent before you, were exclusively men – towards whom We sent the divine revelations, and were dwellers of townships; so have not these people travelled in the land and seen what sort of fate befell those before them? And undoubtedly the abode of the Hereafter is better for the pious; so do you not have sense?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We sent not before you (as Messengers) any but men, whom We inspired from among the people of townships. Have they not travelled through the earth and seen what was the end of those who were before them? And verily, the home of the Hereafter is the best for those who fear Allah and obey Him (by abstaining from sins and evil deeds, and by performing righteous good deeds). Do you not then understand?

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: The Messengers whom We raised before you, (O Muhammad), and to whom We sent down revelations, were only human beings, and were from among those living in earthly habitations. Have these people not travelled in the earth that they may observe the end of their predecessors? Certainly the abode of the Hereafter is much better for those (who accepted the call of the Messengers and) acted in a God-fearing manner. Will you still not act with good sense?

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And We sent not before you (as Messengers) any but men unto whom We revealed, from among the people of townships. Have they not traveled in the land and seen what was the end of those who were before them And verily, the home of the Hereafter is the best for those who have Taqwa. Do you not then understand

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: We sent not before thee (any messengers) save men whom We inspired from among the folk of the townships - Have they not travelled in the land and seen the nature of the consequence for those who were before them? And verily the abode of the Hereafter, for those who ward off (evil), is best. Have ye then no sense? -

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We sent not before you [as messengers] except men to whom We revealed from among the people of cities. So have they not traveled through the earth and observed how was the end of those before them? And the home of the Hereafter is best for those who fear Allah; then will you not reason?

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Messengers whom We sent before you were mere men of the people of the towns. We gave them revelations. Have they (the unbelievers) not travelled sufficiently through the land to see how terrible the end was of those who lived before. The next life is, certainly, better for the pious ones. Will you not then take heed?

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: All the messengers We sent before you [Muhammad] were human beings to whom We made revelations; they were men chosen from the people of their towns. Did they not travel across the earth and see the end of those before them? Those who are mindful of God prefer the life to come. Will you not then understand?

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Nor did We send before thee (as messengers) any but men, whom we did inspire,- (men) living in human habitations. Do they not travel through the earth, and see what was the end of those before them? But the home of the hereafter is best, for those who do right. Will ye not then understand?

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Ibrahim (Abraham) again] said: "What then is the business on which you have come, O Messengers?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: He said: "What then is the business for which you have come, O messengers"

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: He said: And afterward what is your business, O ye messengers (of Allah)?

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘O messengers, what is now your errand?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: He asked: 'Messengers, what is your errand'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Messengers, what is your task?"

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Then he asked, "What then is your business, O messengers?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Abraham said: "What then is the business on which ye (have come), O ye messengers (of Allah)?"

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: When the messengers came to the family of Lot,

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then, when the Messengers (the angels) came unto the family of Lout (Lot).

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Then when the messengers (the angels) came to the family of Lut

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when the messengers came unto the family of Lot,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: So when the messengers came to Lot’s family,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And when the messengers came to the family of Lot,

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: When the Messengers came to the family of Lot,

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When the messengers came to Lot and his family,

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: At length when the messengers arrived among the adherents of Lut,

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And verily, you (O Muhammad SAW) are receiving the Quran from the One, All-Wise, All-Knowing.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: You are receiving the Quran from an All-Wise, All-Knowing.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: As for you, (O Muhammad), you are receiving the Qur'an from the Most Wise, the All-Knowing.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Lo! as for thee (Muhammad), thou verily receivest the Qur'an from the presence of One Wise, Aware.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Indeed you receive the Quran from One who is all-wise, all-knowing.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And indeed, [O Muhammad], you receive the Qur'an from one Wise and Knowing.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), you have certainly received the Quran from the All-wise and All-knowing One.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And most surely you are made to receive the Quran from the Wise, the Knowing Allah.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: You have received this Quran from One who is all-wise, all-knowing.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: When We sent to them two Messengers, they belied them both, so We reinforced them with a third, and they said: "Verily! We have been sent to you as Messengers."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We sent them two messengers, but they denied them both, so We reinforced them with a third. They said, “We are messengers to you.”

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We sent to them two Messengers and they rejected both of them as liars. Then We strengthened them with a third (Messenger).

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: When We sent to them two Messengers, they denied them both; so We reinforced them with a third, and they said: "Verily, we have been sent to you as Messengers."

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We sent to them two, but they belied them so We reinforced them with a third. They said: 'We have surely been sent as Messengers to you'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: When We sent to them two but they denied them, so We strengthened them with a third, and they said, "Indeed, we are messengers to you."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We sent them two Messengers whom they rejected. We supported them by sending a third one who told the people, "We are the Messengers (of God) who have been sent to you".

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: When We sent them two messengers, they rejected them both, so We strengthened them with a third. They said, "Truly, we have been sent to you [by God] as messengers."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: When We (first) sent to them two messengers, they rejected them: But We strengthened them with a third: they said, "Truly, we have been sent on a mission to you."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And indeed Ilyas is one of the Noble Messengers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And verily, Iliyas (Elias) was one of the Messengers.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Also Elijah was one of the messengers.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: Surely, Elias too was among the Messengers.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And verily, Ilyas was one of the Messengers.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And Elias (El Yaseen) was among the Messengers.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And indeed, Elias was from among the messengers,

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Elias was certainly a Messenger.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Elijah too was one of the messengers.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And indeed Lut is one of the Noble Messengers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And verily, Lout (Lot) was one of the Messengers.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And Lot was one of the messengers.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And Lot too was one of the Messengers.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And verily, Lut was one of the Messengers.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Lot, too, was among the Messengers.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And indeed, Lot was among the messengers.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Lot was certainly a Messenger.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Lot was also one of the messengers.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And indeed Yunus is one of the Noble Messengers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And, verily, Yunus (Jonah) was one of the Messengers.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And Jonah was one of the messengers.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And Jonah too was one of the Messengers.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And verily, Yunus was one of the Messengers.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Jonah, too, was one of the Messengers.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And indeed, Jonah was among the messengers.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Jonah was certainly a Messenger.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Jonah too was one of the messengers.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And if We had sent this as a Quran in a foreign language other than Arabic, they would have said: "Why are not its Verses explained in detail (in our language)? What! (A Book) not in Arabic and (the Messenger) an Arab?" Say: "It is for those who believe, a guide and a healing. And as for those who disbelieve, there is heaviness (deafness) in their ears, and it (the Quran) is blindness for them. They are those who are called from a place far away (so they neither listen nor understand).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Had We made it a Quran in a foreign language, they would have said, “If only its verses were made clear.” Non-Arabic and an Arab? Say, “For those who believe, it is guidance and healing. But as for those who do not believe: there is heaviness in their ears, and it is blindness for them. These are being called from a distant place.”

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And if We had appointed it a Lecture in a foreign tongue they would assuredly have said: If only its verses were expounded (so that we might understand)? What! A foreign tongue and an Arab? - Say unto them (O Muhammad): For those who believe it is a guidance and a healing; and as for those who disbelieve, there is a deafness in their ears, and it is blindness for them. Such are called to from afar.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Had We made it a non-Arabic Quran, they would have said, ‘Why have not its signs been articulated?’ ‘What! A non-Arabian [scripture] and an Arabian [prophet]!?’ Say, ‘It is guidance and healing for those who have faith. As for those who are faithless, there is a deafness in their ears and it is lost to their sight: [to them it is as if] they were called from a distant place.’

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And if We had made it a non-Arabic Qur'an, they would have said, "Why are its verses not explained in detail [in our language]? Is it a foreign [recitation] and an Arab [messenger]?" Say, "It is, for those who believe, a guidance and cure." And those who do not believe - in their ears is deafness, and it is upon them blindness. Those are being called from a distant place.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Had We sent down this Quran in a non-Arabic language, they would have said, "Why have its verses not been well expounded?" Could a non-Arabic Book be revealed to an Arabic speaking person? (Muhammad), say, "It is a guide and a cure for the believers. As for those who do not believe, they are deaf and blind. It is as though they had been called from a distant place".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And if We had made it a Quran in a foreign tongue, they would certainly have said: Why have not its communications been made clear? What! a foreign (tongue) and an Arabian! Say: It is to those who believe a guidance and a healing; and (as for) those who do not believe, there is a heaviness in their ears and it is obscure to them; these shall be called to from a far-off place.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Had We sent this as a Quran [in a language] other than Arabic, they would have said, "Why are its verses not clearly explained? What! An Arab Prophet, and a scripture in a foreign tongue?" Say, "It is a guide and a healing to those who believe; but for those who do not believe, there is a deafness in their ears, and a covering over their eyes: they are [as it were] being called from a very distant place."

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Had We sent this as a Qur'an (in the language) other than Arabic, they would have said: "Why are not its verses explained in detail? What! (a Book) not in Arabic and (a Messenger an Arab?" Say: "It is a Guide and a Healing to those who believe; and for those who believe not, there is a deafness in their ears, and it is blindness in their (eyes): They are (as it were) being called from a place far distant!"

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when We sent towards you (Muhammad SAW) Nafran (three to ten persons) of the jinns, (quietly) listening to the Quran, when they stood in the presence thereof, they said: "Listen in silence!" And when it was finished, they returned to their people, as warners.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Recall when We dispatched towards you a number of jinn, to listen to the Quran. When they came in its presence, they said, “Pay attention!” Then, when it was concluded, they rushed to their people, warning them.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And when We inclined toward thee (Muhammad) certain of the jinn, who wished to hear the Qur'an and, when they were in its presence, said: Give ear! and, when it was finished, turned back to their people, warning.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When We dispatched toward you a team of jinn listening to the Quran, when they were in its presence, they said, ‘Be silent!’ When it was finished, they went back to their people as warners.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: (Remember) how We sent to you (Prophet Muhammad) a company of jinn who, when they came and listened to the Koran, said to each other: 'Be silent' Then, when it was finished, they returned to their nation and warned them.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We directed to you a few of the jinn, listening to the Qur'an. And when they attended it, they said, "Listen quietly." And when it was concluded, they went back to their people as warners.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We turned a party of jinn towards you to listen to the Quran. When they attended a Quranic recitation, they said to each other, "Be silent," and, when it was over, they turned back to their people, in warning,

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when We turned towards you a party of the jinn who listened to the Quran; so when they came to it, they said: Be silent; then when it was finished, they turned back to their people warning (them).

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Remember how We sent to you a band of jinn who wished to hear the Quran and as they listened to its recitation, they said to one another, "Be silent and listen," and, then when it was finished, they went back to their people, to give them warning.

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: He said: "What is then your business, O messengers?"

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: [Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Then for what purpose you have come, O Messengers?"

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: (Ibrahim) said: "Then for what purpose you have come, O messengers"

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: He said, ‘O messengers, what is now your errand?’

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: 'Messengers' said he (Abraham), 'what is your errand'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Abraham asked, "Messengers, what is your task?"

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Abraham asked, "What is your errand, O messengers?"

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: (Abraham) said: "And what, O ye Messengers, is your errand (now)?"

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Whatever you (O Muhammad SAW) may be doing, and whatever portion you may be reciting from the Quran, - and whatever deed you (mankind) may be doing (good or evil), We are Witness thereof, when you are doing it. And nothing is hidden from your Lord (so much as) the weight of an atom (or small ant) on the earth or in the heaven. Not what is less than that or what is greater than that but is (written) in a Clear Record. (Tafsir At-Tabari. Vol. 11, Page 129).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: You do not get into any situation, nor do you recite any Quran, nor do you do anything, but We are watching over you as you undertake it. Not even the weight of an atom, on earth or in the sky, escapes your Lord, nor is there anything smaller or larger, but is in a clear record.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And thou (Muhammad) art not occupied with any business and thou recitest not a Lecture from this (Scripture), and ye (mankind) perform no act, but We are Witness of you when ye are engaged therein. And not an atom's weight in the earth or in the sky escapeth your Lord, nor what is less than that or greater than that, but it is (written) in a clear Book.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: You do not engage in any work, neither do you recite any part of the Quran, nor do you perform any deed without Our being witness over you when you are engaged therein. Not an atom’s weight escapes your Lord in the earth or in the sky, nor [is there] anything smaller than that nor bigger, but it is in a manifest Book.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And, [O Muhammad], you are not [engaged] in any matter or recite any of the Qur'an and you [people] do not do any deed except that We are witness over you when you are involved in it. And not absent from your Lord is any [part] of an atom's weight within the earth or within the heaven or [anything] smaller than that or greater but that it is in a clear register.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), We bear witness to all your affairs; whatever you recite from the Quran and whatever you (people) do. Nothing in the heavens or the earth is hidden from your Lord, even that which is as small as an atom's weight or greater or smaller. All is recorded in the glorious Book.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And you are not (engaged) in any affair, nor do you recite concerning it any portion of the Quran, nor do you do any work but We are witnesses over you when you enter into it, and there does not lie concealed from your Lord the weight of an atom in the earth or in the heaven, nor any thing less than that nor greater, but it is in a clear book.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: In whatever activity you may be engaged, and whichever part of the Quran you recite, and whatever deed you do, We are witness to it when you are engaged in it. Not the smallest particle on the earth or in heaven is hidden from your Lord; and there is nothing smaller or bigger but is recorded in a clear Book.

translation.author: Dr. Muhammad Muhsin
translation.text: Narrated Muhammad bin Abi Bakr Al-Thaqafi: While we were going from Mina to 'Arafat, I asked Anas bin Malik, about Talbiya, "How did you use to say Talbiya in the company of the Prophet?" Anas said: "People used to say Talbiya and their saying was not objected to and they used to say Takbir and that was not objected to either. "

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed, We have bestowed upon you seven of Al-Mathani (the seven repeatedly recited Verses), (i.e. Surat Al-Fatiha) and the Grand Quran.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We have given you seven of the pairs, and the Grand Quran.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly We have given you [the surah of] the seven oft-repeated verses and the great Quran.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We have certainly given you, [O Muhammad], seven of the often repeated [verses] and the great Qur'an.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), We have given you the seven most repeated (verses) and the great Quran.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We have given you seven of the oft-repeated (verses) and the grand Quran.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We have given you the seven oft-recited verses and the great Quran.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) when We told you: "Verily! Your Lord has encompassed mankind (i.e. they are in His Grip)." And We made not the vision which we showed you (O Muhammad as an actual eye-witness and not as a dream on the night of Al-Isra') but a trial for mankind, and likewise the accursed tree (Zaqqum, mentioned) in the Quran. We warn and make them afraid but it only increases them in naught save great disbelief, oppression and disobedience to Allah.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We said to you that your Lord encompasses humanity. We did not make the vision We showed you, except as a test for the people, and the tree cursed in the Quran. We frighten them, but that only increases their defiance.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And recall when We said to you, (O Muhammad), that your Lord encompasses these people; and that We have made that vision that We have shown you, and the tree accursed in the Qur'an, but as a trial for people. We go about warning them, but each warning leads them to greater transgression.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: When We said to you, ‘Indeed your Lord encircles those people,’ We did not appoint the vision that We showed you except as a tribulation for the people and the tree cursed in the Quran. We warn them, but it only increases them in their outrageous rebellion.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [remember, O Muhammad], when We told you, "Indeed, your Lord has encompassed the people." And We did not make the sight which We showed you except as a trial for the people, as was the accursed tree [mentioned] in the Qur'an. And We threaten them, but it increases them not except in great transgression.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), We told you that your Lord has encompassed all mankind. We made the vision which We showed you and the condemned tree, mentioned in the Quran, as a trial for the human being. Even though We warn them, it only increases their rebellion.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And when We said to you: Surely your Lord encompasses men; and We did not make the vision which We showed you but a trial for men and the cursed tree in the Quran as well; and We cause them to fear, but it only adds to their great inordinacy.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We told you that your Lord encompasses mankind. We granted the vision which We showed you, as well as the tree that is cursed in the Quran, only as a test for mankind. We warn them, but this only increases their insolence.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Then High above all be Allah, the True King. And be not in haste (O Muhammad SAW) with the Quran before its revelation is completed to you, and say: "My Lord! Increase me in knowledge."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Exalted is God, the True King. Do not be hasty with the Quran before its inspiration to you is concluded, and say, “My Lord, increase me in knowledge.”

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Then exalted be Allah, the True King! And hasten not (O Muhammad) with the Qur'an ere its revelation hath been perfected unto thee, and say: My Lord! Increase me in knowledge.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: So exalted is Allah, the True Sovereign. Do not hasten with the Quran before its revelation is completed for you, and say, ‘My Lord! Increase me in knowledge.’

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: So high [above all] is Allah, the Sovereign, the Truth. And, [O Muhammad], do not hasten with [recitation of] the Qur'an before its revelation is completed to you, and say, "My Lord, increase me in knowledge."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: God is the Most High and the True King. (Muhammad), do not be hasty in reading the Quran to the people before the revelation has been completed. "Say, My Lord, grant me more knowledge."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Supremely exalted is therefore Allah, the King, the Truth, and do not make haste with the Quran before its revelation is made complete to you and say: O my Lord! increase me in knowledge.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: exalted is God, the True King. Do not be impatient with the Quran before its revelation is completed, and say, "My Lord, increase my knowledge."

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: “Therefore approach Firaun then proclaim, ‘We both are Noble Messengers of the Lord Of The Creation.’

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: So go you to Pharaoh, and say, "Verily, I am the Messenger of the Lord of all Being;

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: "And when you both come to Fir'aun (Pharaoh), say: 'We are the Messengers of the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists),

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Go to Pharaoh, and say, ‘We are the Messengers of the Lord of the Worlds.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: "And go both of you to Fira`wn, and say: `We are the Messengers of the Lord of Al-`Alamin,'

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: go both to Pharaoh and both of you say to him: 'We are (each) a Messenger from the Lord of all the Worlds.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Go to Pharaoh and say, 'We are the messengers of the Lord of the worlds,

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Go to Pharaoh, both of you, and say, 'We are messengers from the Lord of the Worlds:

translation.author: Ahmed Ali
translation.text: (The messengers) said: "Our Lord knows that we have been sent to you.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: The Messengers said: "Our Lord knows that we have been sent as Messengers to you,

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: They said, “Our Lord knows that we are messengers to you.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: The Messengers said: “Our Lord knows that we have indeed been sent to you

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: The Messengers said: "Our Lord knows that we have been sent as Messengers to you,"

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: They said: 'Our Lord knows that we are Messengers to you.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: They said, "Our Lord knows that we are messengers to you,

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They said, "Our Lord knows that We are Messengers

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And, verily, Our Word has gone forth of old for Our slaves, the Messengers,

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Our Word has already gone out to our servant messengers.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: We have already given Our promise to Our Messengers

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And, verily, Our Word has gone forth of old for Our servants, the Messengers,

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Our Word had already preceded Our worshipers, the Messengers,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And Our word has already preceded for Our servants, the messengers,

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We decreed that Our Messenger servants

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: And surely Our word has gone forth respecting Our servants, the messengers:

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: We know of best what they say; and you (O Muhammad SAW) are not a tyrant over them (to force them to Belief). But warn by the Quran, him who fears My Threat.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We are fully aware of what they say, and you are not a dictator over them. So remind by the Quran whoever fears My warning.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: We are Best Aware of what they say, and thou (O Muhammad) art in no wise a compeller over them. But warn by the Qur'an him who feareth My threat.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: We know well what they say, and you are not there to compel them. So admonish by the Quran those who fear My threat.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Indeed, We know what they say. You (Prophet Muhammad) are not a tyrant over them. Therefore, remind by the Koran whosoever fears (My) threat.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We know best what they say and you cannot compel them. Remind, by way of the Quran, those who have fear of My warnings.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: We know best what they say, and you are not one to compel them; therefore remind him by means of the Quran who fears My threat.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We know best what those who deny the truth say. You are not there to force them: so remind, with this Quran, those who fear My warning.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: There is no duty upon the Noble Messenger except to convey the command; and Allah knows all what you disclose and all what you hide.

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: It is only for the Messenger to deliver the Message; and God knows what you reveal and what you hide.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: The Messenger's duty [i.e. Our Messenger Muhammad SAW whom We have sent to you, (O mankind)] is but to convey (the Message). And Allah knows all that you reveal and all that you conceal.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: The Messenger is bound only to deliver the message, whereafter Allah knows well all that you disclose and all that you conceal.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: The duty of the messenger is only to convey (the message). Allah knoweth what ye proclaim and what ye hide.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: The duty of the Messenger is only the delivery (of the Message). Allah knows what you reveal and what you hide.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Not upon the Messenger is [responsibility] except [for] notification. And Allah knows whatever you reveal and whatever you conceal.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The duty of the Messenger is only to preach. God knows what you reveal or hide.

translation.author: Ahmed Raza Khan
translation.text: And We have indeed sent Noble Messengers towards the nations that were before you – We therefore seized them with hardship and adversity so that, in some way, they may humbly plead.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Verily, We sent (Messengers) to many nations before you (O Muhammad SAW). And We seized them with extreme poverty (or loss in wealth) and loss in health with calamities so that they might believe with humility.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We sent messengers to communities before you, and We afflicted them with suffering and hardship, that they may humble themselves.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: And We did indeed send Messengers to other nations before you and then We seized those nations with misfortune and hardship so that they might humble themselves (before Us).

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Verily, We sent (Messengers) to many nations before you. And We seized them with extreme poverty and loss of health so that they might believe with humility.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We have already sent [messengers] to nations before you, [O Muhammad]; then We seized them with poverty and hardship that perhaps they might humble themselves [to Us].

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We sent messengers before you [Prophet] to many communities and afflicted their people with suffering and hardship, so that they might humble themselves.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Before thee We sent (messengers) to many nations, and We afflicted the nations with suffering and adversity, that they might learn humility.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Say (O Muhammad SAW): "It has been revealed to me that a group (from three to ten in number) of jinns listened (to this Quran). They said: 'Verily! We have heard a wonderful Recital (this Quran)!

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Say, “It was revealed to me that a band of jinn listened in, and said, ‘We have heard a wondrous Quran.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Say (O Muhammad): It is revealed unto me that a company of the Jinn gave ear, and they said: Lo! we have heard a marvellous Qur'an,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Say, ‘It has been revealed to me that a team of the jinn listened [to the Quran] and they said, “Indeed we heard a wonderful Quran,

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Say, [O Muhammad], "It has been revealed to me that a group of the jinn listened and said, 'Indeed, we have heard an amazing Qur'an.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), say, "It has been revealed to me that a party of jinn has listened (to the recitation) of the Quran and has told (their people), "We heard an amazing reading

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Say: It has been revealed to me that a party of the jinn listened, and they said: Surely we have heard a wonderful Quran,

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Say, "It has been revealed to me that a band of the jinn listened [to the Quran] and they said, "We have heard a really wonderful recital,

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We sent not (as Our Messengers) before you (O Muhammad SAW) any but men, whom We inspired, (to preach and invite mankind to believe in the Oneness of Allah). So ask of those who know the Scripture [learned men of the Taurat (Torah) and the Injeel (Gospel)], if you know not.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (O Muhammad), whenever We raised any Messengers before you, they were no other than human beings; (except that) to them We sent revelation. So ask those who possess knowledge if you do not know.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And We sent not (as Our Messengers) before you (O Muhammad) any but men, whom We sent revelation. So ask Ahl Adh-Dhikr, if you know not.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We sent not (as Our messengers) before thee other than men whom We inspired - Ask the followers of the Remembrance if ye know not! -

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The Messengers whom We sent before you were mere mortals to whom We had sent with miracles and revelations. Ask those who know about the heavenly Books if you do not know about this.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Before you also the messengers We sent were but [mortal] men to whom We vouchsafed revelation. Ask the People of the Book, if you do not know.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: And before thee also the messengers We sent were but men, to whom We granted inspiration: if ye realise this not, ask of those who possess the Message.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And (remember) the Day when We shall raise up from every nation a witness against them from amongst themselves. And We shall bring you (O Muhammad SAW) as a witness against these. And We have sent down to you the Book (the Quran) as an exposition of everything, a guidance, a mercy, and glad tidings for those who have submitted themselves (to Allah as Muslims).

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (O Muhammad), warn them of the coming of a Day when We shall bring forth a witness against them from each community and We shall bring you forth as a witness against them all; (and it is for that purpose that) We sent down the Book to you which makes everything clear, and serves as a guidance and mercy and glad tidings to those who have submitted to Allah.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: And on the Day when We resurrect a witness from each nation from among themselves, and We bring you (O Muhammad) as a witness against these. And We have revealed the Book (the Qur'an) to you as an explanation of everything, a guidance, a mercy, and good news for the Muslims.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And (bethink you of) the day when We raise in every nation a witness against them of their own folk, and We bring thee (Muhammad) as a witness against these. And We reveal the Scripture unto thee as an exposition of all things, and a guidance and a mercy and good tidings for those who have surrendered (to Allah).

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: And on that Day We shall raise up from every nation a witness from their own against them, and We shall bring you (Prophet Muhammad) as a witness against those. And We have sent down to you the Book making everything clear, as a guidance, and mercy, and glad tidings to those who submit.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And [mention] the Day when We will resurrect among every nation a witness over them from themselves. And We will bring you, [O Muhammad], as a witness over your nation. And We have sent down to you the Book as clarification for all things and as guidance and mercy and good tidings for the Muslims.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: On the day when We call a witness against every nation from their own people, We will call you, (Muhammad), as a witness against them all. We have sent you the Book which clarifies all matters. It is a guide, a mercy, and glad news to the Muslims.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We have put coverings over their hearts lest, they should understand it (the Quran), and in their ears deafness. And when you make mention of your Lord Alone [La ilaha ill-Allah (none has the right to be worshipped but Allah) Islamic Monotheism] in the Quran, they turn on their backs, fleeing in extreme dislikeness.

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: And We drape veils over their hearts, preventing them from understanding it, and heaviness in their ears. And when you mention your Lord alone in the Quran, they turn their backs in aversion.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: and We cast veils on their hearts, lest they should understand it, and a deafness into their ears. When you mention your Lord alone in the Quran, they turn their backs in aversion.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: We lay veils upon their hearts and heaviness in their ears, lest they understand it. When you (Prophet Muhammad) mention your Lord alone in the Koran, they turn their backs in aversion.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We put a veil over their hearts so that they cannot understand it. We deafen their ears. When you mention your Lord in this Quran as One (Supreme Being), they run away.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And We have placed coverings on their hearts and a heaviness in their ears lest they understand it, and when you mention your Lord alone in the Quran they turn their backs in aversion.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We put veils over their hearts to prevent them from comprehending it, and We afflict their ears with deafness. When you mention your one and only Lord in your recitation of the Quran, they turn their backs in aversion.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And thus We have sent it down as a Quran in Arabic, and have explained therein in detail the warnings, in order that they may fear Allah, or that it may cause them to have a lesson from it (or to have the honour for believing and acting on its teachings).

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: Thus We have revealed it an Arabic Quran, and We have diversified the warnings in it, that perhaps they would become righteous, or it may produce a lesson for them.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (O Muhammad), thus have We revealed this as an Arabic Qur'an and have expounded in it warning in diverse ways so that they may avoid evil or become heedful.

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Thus We have sent it down as an Arabic Quran and We have paraphrased the warnings in it variously so that they may be Godwary, or it may prompt them to remembrance.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We have revealed the Quran in the Arabic language containing various warnings so that it may cause them to have fear (of God) or take heed.

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And thus have We sent it down an Arabic Quran, and have distinctly set forth therein of threats that they may guard (against evil) or that it may produce a reminder for them.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We have thus sent down the Quran in Arabic and given all kinds of warnings in it, so that they may fear God, or may take heed --

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: We have not sent down the Quran unto you (O Muhammad SAW) to cause you distress,

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We did not reveal the Quran to you to make you suffer.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: We have not revealed unto thee (Muhammad) this Qur'an that thou shouldst be distressed,

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: We did not send down to you the Quran that you should be miserable,

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We have sent the Quran only as reminder

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: We have not revealed the Quran to you that you may be unsuccessful.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: We have not sent the Quran down to you to distress you,

translation.author: Arberry
translation.text: Nay, but they say: 'A hotchpotch of nightmares! Nay, he has forged it; nay, he is a poet! Now therefore let him bring us a sign, even as the ancient ones were sent as Messengers.'

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Nay, they say:"These (revelations of the Quran which are inspired to Muhammad SAW) are mixed up false dreams! Nay, he has invented it! Nay, he is a poet! Let him then bring us an Ayah (sign as a proof) like the ones (Prophets) that were sent before (with signs)!"

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: They say: "Nay, these are confused dreams; nay, he has forged it; nay, he is a poet. So let him bring us a sign, even as the Messengers of the past were sent with signs."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Nay, say they, (these are but) muddled dreams; nay, he hath but invented it; nay, he is but a poet. Let him bring us a portent even as those of old (who were Allah's messengers) were sent (with portents).

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: But they say, "[The revelation is but] a mixture of false dreams; rather, he has invented it; rather, he is a poet. So let him bring us a sign just as the previous [messengers] were sent [with miracles]."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: They have said, "It, (the Quran), is only the result of some confused dreams. He is only a poet. He should show us some miracles, as the ancient Prophets had done."

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Some say, "These are his confused dreams." Others say, "He has invented it himself," and yet others say, "He is a poet. Let him bring us a sign as previous messengers did."

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And We sent not before you (O Muhammad SAW) but men to whom We inspired, so ask the people of the Reminder [Scriptures - the Taurat (Torah), the Injeel (Gospel)] if you do not know.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (O Muhammad), even before you We never sent any other than human beings as Messengers, and to them We sent revelation. Ask the People of the Book if you do not know.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: And We sent not (as Our messengers) before thee other than men, whom We inspired. Ask the followers of the Reminder if ye know not?

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We sent not before you, [O Muhammad], except men to whom We revealed [the message], so ask the people of the message if you do not know.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: The messengers that We had sent before you were only men to whom We had given revelation. Ask the People of the Book if you do not know.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: The messengers We sent before you were but men whom We had sent revelations. Ask the People of the Book if you do not know this --

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: Before thee, also, the messengers We sent were but men, to whom We granted inspiration: If ye realise this not, ask of those who possess the Message.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Whoever thinks that Allah will not help him (Muhammad SAW) in this world and in the Hereafter, let him stretch out a rope to the ceiling and let him strangle himself. Then let him see whether his plan will remove that whereat he rages!

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Whoso is wont to think (through envy) that Allah will not give him (Muhammad) victory in the world and the Hereafter (and is enraged at the thought of his victory), let him stretch a rope up to the roof (of his dwelling), and let him hang himself. Then let him see whether his strategy dispelleth that whereat he rageth!.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: If any one thinks that Allah will not give him (Prophet Muhammad) victory in this present world and in the Everlasting Life, let him stretch a rope to heaven, and let him sever it. Then, let him see if his guile does away with that which has enraged him.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Whoever should think that Allah will not support [Prophet Muhammad] in this world and the Hereafter - let him extend a rope to the ceiling, then cut off [his breath], and let him see: will his effort remove that which enrages [him]?

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: Those who thought that God would never grant victory to (Muhammad), in this world nor in the life hereafter (and now that he is victorious) should hang themselves by the necks from the ceiling, then cut the rope and see if this can do away with what has enraged them.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Anyone who thinks that God will not help him [His messenger] in this world and the Hereafter, let him stretch a rope up to the sky; then let him cut it off and see if his plan can help to remove the cause of his anger.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: If any think that Allah will not help him (His Messenger) in this world and the Hereafter, let him stretch out a rope to the ceiling and cut (himself) off: then let him see whether his plan will remove that which enrages (him)!

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Verily, He Who has given you (O Muhammad SAW) the Quran (i.e. ordered you to act on its laws and to preach it to others) will surely bring you back to the Ma'ad (place of return, either to Makkah or to Paradise after your death, etc.). Say (O Muhammad SAW): "My Lord is Aware of him who brings guidance, and he who is in manifest error."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: He Who ordained the Quran for you will return you Home. Say, “My Lord knows best who comes with guidance, and who is in manifest error.”

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Indeed He who has revealed to you the Quran will surely restore you to the place of return. Say, ‘My Lord knows best him who brings guidance and him who is in manifest error.’

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Indeed, [O Muhammad], He who imposed upon you the Qur'an will take you back to a place of return. Say, "My Lord is most knowing of who brings guidance and who is in clear error."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), God, Who has commanded you to follow the guidance of the Quran, will certainly return you victoriously to your place of birth. Say, "My Lord knows best who has brought guidance and who is in plain error."

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: Most surely He Who has made the Quran binding on you will bring you back to the destination. Say: My Lord knows best him who has brought the guidance and him who is in manifest error.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: He who has entrusted you with the responsibility of the Quran, will surely lead you to a successful end. Say, "My Lord knows best who is rightly guided and who is in gross error."

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Not upon you (Muhammad SAW) is their guidance, but Allah guides whom He wills. And whatever you spend in good, it is for yourselves, when you spend not except seeking Allah's Countenance. And whatever you spend in good, it will be repaid to you in full, and you shall not be wronged.

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Not upon you (Muhammad) is their guidance, but Allah guides whom He wills. And whatever you spend in good, it is for yourselves, when you spend not except seeking Allah's Face. And whatever you spend in good, it will be repaid to you in full, and you shall not be wronged.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: The guiding of them is not thy duty (O Muhammad), but Allah guideth whom He will. And whatsoever good thing ye spend, it is for yourselves, when ye spend not save in search of Allah's Countenance; and whatsoever good thing ye spend, it will be repaid to you in full, and ye will not be wronged.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: It is not for you (Prophet Muhammad to cause) their guidance. Allah guides whom He will. Whatever good you spend is for yourselves, provided that you give it desiring the Face of Allah. And whatever good you spend shall be repaid to you in full, you shall not be harmed.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Not upon you, [O Muhammad], is [responsibility for] their guidance, but Allah guides whom He wills. And whatever good you [believers] spend is for yourselves, and you do not spend except seeking the countenance of Allah. And whatever you spend of good - it will be fully repaid to you, and you will not be wronged.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), you do not have to guide them. God guides whomever He wants. Whatever you spend for the cause of God is for your own good, provided you do not spend anything but to please God. For anything good that you may give for the cause of God, you will receive sufficient reward and no injustice will be done to you.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: It is not required of thee (O Messenger), to set them on the right path, but Allah sets on the right path whom He pleaseth. Whatever of good ye give benefits your own souls, and ye shall only do so seeking the "Face" of Allah. Whatever good ye give, shall be rendered back to you, and ye shall not Be dealt with unjustly.

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: And indeed We have set forth for mankind, in this Quran every kind of parable. But if you (O Muhammad SAW) bring to them any sign or proof, (as an evidence for the truth of your Prophethood), the disbelievers are sure to say (to the believers): "You follow nothing but falsehood, and magic."

translation.author: Itani
translation.text: We have cited in this Quran for the people every sort of parable. But even if you bring them a miracle, those who disbelieve will say, “You are nothing but fakers.”

translation.author: Qarai
translation.text: Certainly we have drawn for mankind in this Quran every [kind of] parable. Indeed if you bring them a sign, the faithless will surely say, ‘You are nothing but fabricators!’

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: And We have certainly presented to the people in this Qur'an from every [kind of] example. But, [O Muhammad], if you should bring them a sign, the disbelievers will surely say, "You [believers] are but falsifiers."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: We have told people various parables in this Quran. Even if you had shown them a miracle, the unbelievers would have said, "You are only the followers of falsehood".

translation.author: Shakir
translation.text: And certainly We have set forth for men every kind of example in this Quran; and if you should bring them a communication, those who disbelieve would certainly say: You are naught but false claimants.

translation.author: Wahiduddin Khan
translation.text: Truly, We have set forth for men in this Quran every kind of parable and indeed, if you bring them a sign, those who are bent on denying the truth are sure to say, "You are only making false claims!"

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: Say (O Muhammad SAW to mankind): "If you (really) love Allah then follow me (i.e. accept Islamic Monotheism, follow the Quran and the Sunnah), Allah will love you and forgive you of your sins. And Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful."

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (O Messenger!) Tell people: 'If you indeed love Allah, follow me, and Allah will love you and will forgive you your sins. Allah is All-Forgiving, All-Compassionate.'

translation.author: Mubarakpuri
translation.text: Say (O Muhammad to mankind): "If you (really) love Allah, then follow me (i.e. Muhammad), Allah will love you and forgive you your sins. And Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful."

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: Say, (O Muhammad, to mankind): If ye love Allah, follow me; Allah will love you and forgive you your sins. Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: Say (Prophet Muhammad): 'If you love Allah, follow me and Allah will love you, and forgive your sins. Allah is Forgiving and Merciful'

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: Say, [O Muhammad], "If you should love Allah, then follow me, [so] Allah will love you and forgive you your sins. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful."

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), tell them, "If you love God, follow me. God will love you and forgive your sins. God is All-forgiving and All-merciful."

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
translation.text: This is a part of the news of the Ghaib (unseen, i.e. the news of the past nations of which you have no knowledge) which We inspire you with (O Muhammad SAW). You were not with them, when they cast lots with their pens as to which of them should be charged with the care of Maryam (Mary); nor were you with them when they disputed.

translation.author: Maududi
translation.text: (O Muhammad!) We reveal to you this account from a realm which lies beyond the reach of your perception for you were not with them when they drew lots with their pens about who should be Mary's guardian, and you were not with them when they disputed about it.

translation.author: Pickthall
translation.text: This is of the tidings of things hidden. We reveal it unto thee (Muhammad). Thou wast not present with them when they threw their pens (to know) which of them should be the guardian of Mary, nor wast thou present with them when they quarrelled (thereupon).

translation.author: Qaribullah & Darwish
translation.text: This is from the news of the unseen. We reveal it to you (Prophet Muhammad). You were not present when they cast their quills to see which of them should look after Mary, nor were you present when they were disputing.

translation.author: Saheeh International
translation.text: That is from the news of the unseen which We reveal to you, [O Muhammad]. And you were not with them when they cast their pens as to which of them should be responsible for Mary. Nor were you with them when they disputed.

translation.author: Sarwar
translation.text: (Muhammad), that was some of the news about the unseen, that We have revealed to you. You were not among those who cast lots by throwing their arrows to find out who would take custody of Mary, nor were you among those who disputed the matter.

translation.author: Yusuf Ali
translation.text: This is part of the tidings of the things unseen, which We reveal unto thee (O Messenger!) by inspiration: Thou wast not with them when they cast lots with arrows, as to which of them should be charged with the care of Mary: Nor wast thou with them when they disputed (the point).

translation.author: Hilali & Khan
